Title: Office Manager

Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You‚Äôll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us‚Äîwith the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant

Vorbereitung und Nachbereitung von Besprechungen, inklusive Protokollf√ºhrung. Bearbeitung von vertraulicher Korrespondenz und Dokumenten. Verwaltung und Priorisierung der eingehenden Anfragen an die Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung. Erstellung von Pr√§sentationen, Berichten und Analysen. Title: Office Manager

Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You‚Äôll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us‚Äîwith the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager (Part Time) ‚Äì Workplace & Office Operations
Description: Your role As our Office Manager , your role goes beyond creating a pleasant atmosphere ‚Äì you're responsible for building and maintaining the foundation of a well-structured, safe, and smoothly functioning office workspace and infrastructure. With a solution-oriented and hands-on mindset, you take ownership of the spaces, routines, and resources that keep our daily office life running. Infuse positive energy into the work environment, putting smiles on the faces of employees, applicants, suppliers, and visitors You will take full ownership of our office infrastructure for more than 250 people ‚Äì this includes planning and organizing the office layout, coordinating furniture needs, and ensuring a functional, well-designed workspace You'll also manage security and access control, making sure everyone can work safely and efficiently Regular facility checks and ensuring safety compliance are also part of your weekly routine Coordinate and manage relationships with vendors and service providers to ensure a seamless day-to-day office operation Collaborate closely with our Office Management team of three to continuously improve our office workflows, support internal teams, and foster a culture of sustainability and operational excellence Your profile Ideally, you have professional experience in Administration, Office Management, Reception & Front Desk, Business Operations, or Operations Management You should have experience working in large office spaces and managing their operations ‚Äì know-how in office expansions or multi-site operations is a big plus! Ideally, you also bring knowledge in office safety & security management, office space and furniture planning, and facility maintenance, and understand their importance for operational efficiency and the overall employee experience You embody an open, helpful nature, combined with an independent working style and a strong desire to take ownership of your projects You have very good communication skills in both English and German, and you're available for 32 hours per week starting from November What we offer An appealing discount on all of our products ‚Äì from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation' We offer German and English language courses ‚Äì financed entirely by us! Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Contact Sabrina Thome Apply for this job About Us Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy ‚Äì as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations. We take our ecological responsibility very seriously : Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable. We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues. We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don‚Äôt match with 100% of the requirements. Title: Assistent:In Der Gesch√§ftsleitung

Howden ist aktuell der am st√§rksten wachsende Versicherungsmakler. Unsere Kunden werden eng bei der Identifikation ihrer Risiken unterst√ºtzt. Daraus erfolgt eine Konzeption passgenauer und individueller Risikol√∂sungen. Wir betreuen unsere Kunden in einem ganzheitlichen Ansatz. Durch unser ‚ÄûPeople First‚Äú-Prinzip stehen die Mitarbeitenden bei uns an erster Stelle ‚Äì was auch das hohe Ma√ü der Mitarbeiterbeteiligung an unserem Unternehmen widerspiegelt. Wir f√∂rdern ihre fachliche Expertise in gleichem Ma√üe wie unseren Teamgeist und setzen auf langfristige Beziehungen. Ihre Aufgaben: Unterst√ºtzung des Vorstands Sie unterst√ºtzen den Vorstand in der t√§glichen Arbeit und sorgen f√ºr einen reibungslosen Ablauf aller Aufgaben und Termine. Erstellung von Pr√§sentationen Entwickeln Sie komplexe Pr√§sentationen f√ºr Vorstandssitzungen, die entscheidende Informationen klar und √ºberzeugend darstellen. Das bringen Sie mit: Erfolgreicher Abschluss eines betriebswirtschaftlichen Studiums Sie verf√ºgen √ºber ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in BWL o.√§. oder verf√ºgen √ºber eine Ausbildung als Versicherungsfachwirt/-in. Langj√§hrige Berufserfahrung In dem genannten T√§tigkeitsfeld (idealerweise in der Versicherungs-/Finanzdienstleistungsbranche) sind Sie ein/e Experte/in und darin macht Ihnen niemand etwas vor. Sie m√∂chten Ihr umfangreiches Wissen in spannenden und internationalen Projekten produktiv anwenden. Gute EDV-Kenntnisse Egal ob Word, Excel oder PowerPoint ‚Äì die Standard-Programme beherrschen Sie aus dem Effeff. Ihre sehr gute Auffassungsgabe erleichtert es Ihnen, sich in spezifische Programme einzuarbeiten. Flie√üende Englischkenntnisse Schriftliche und m√ºndliche Kommunikation in englischer Sprache stellt f√ºr Sie kein Hindernis dar. Unser Angebot: Statt unsere Benefits einfach aufzulisten, haben wir unsere Kolleg*innen gefragt: ‚ÄûWas macht das Arbeiten bei Howden Deutschland AG besonders?‚Äú Diese Antworten kamen: Spa√ü ‚ÄûMir macht es einfach Spa√ü, morgens ins B√ºro zu kommen. Ich freue mich auf meine Aufgaben und den Austausch mit netten Kolleg*innen. Auch wenn es mal stressig wird, lachen wir trotzdem zusammen und unterst√ºtzen einander.‚Äú Flexibilit√§t ‚ÄûIch liebe es, zwischen B√ºro und mobilem Arbeiten wechseln zu k√∂nnen. Dadurch bin ich leistungsf√§higer.‚Äú Gesundheit ‚ÄûIch habe jedes Jahr ein Gesundheitsbudget von 1.000 ‚Ç¨ zur Verf√ºgung, um mich im Krankheitsfall als Privatpatient behandeln zu lassen. Howden sorgt daf√ºr, dass ich gesund werde und auch bleibe.‚Äú Altersvorsorge/-absicherung ‚ÄûHowden bezuschusst meine Altersvorsorge und ohne Howden h√§tte ich niemals eine Berufsunf√§higkeitsversicherung bekommen.‚Äù Gruppenunfallversicherung ‚ÄûHowden hat keine Standard-Unfallversicherung f√ºr die Mitarbeiter abgeschlossen, sondern eine, die nicht nur mich, sondern auch meine Familie absichert, sollte es zum √Ñu√üersten kommen.‚Äú F√ºhrung auf Augenh√∂he ‚ÄûMir ist wichtig, dass meine F√ºhrungskraft mir Freiraum l√§sst f√ºr die Erledigung meiner Aufgaben und ich dabei meine eigenen Ideen entwickeln kann. Ich sehe sie/ihn als Sparrings-Partner*in, nicht als ‚ÄûBoss‚Äú.‚Äú Internationalit√§t ‚ÄûMir gef√§llt es, international zu arbeiten. Seit ich bei Howden arbeite, sind meine Sprachkenntnisse enorm gewachsen. Ich habe die M√∂glichkeit mit Kunden-/ Versicherungsunternehmen weltweit zu arbeiten und meinen Horizont zu erweitern.‚Äú Attraktive Verg√ºtung und Sozialleistungen ‚ÄûNeben dem attraktiven Gehalt, finde ich es toll, dass Howden Weiterbildungen nicht nur f√∂rdert, sondern ich dabei auch tatkr√§ftig unterst√ºtzt werde.‚Äú [Anm.d.Red.: Danke f√ºr das Lob. Wir haben noch viele weitere Benefits zu bieten, wie z. B.: betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Firmenevents, freie Brauchtumstage u.v.m.] Gewissenhafte Einarbeitung ‚ÄûIch habe mich w√§hrend meiner Einarbeitungszeit sehr gut aufgehoben gef√ºhlt und konnte mich schnell nicht nur fachlich, sondern auch menschlich in das Team einarbeiten bzw. integrieren. Nach wie vor finde ich den unkomplizierten Austausch unter den Kolleg*innen toll.‚Äú Patenschaft ‚ÄûIch habe mich in meinen ersten 3 Monaten regelm√§√üig mit meinem Paten auf einen Kaffee oder auch zum Mittagessen verabredet. Es ging nicht um arbeitstechnische Abl√§ufe, sondern er hat mich in die Kultur hier am Standort eingef√ºhrt.‚Äú Mitarbeiterbeteiligung ‚ÄûDie Mitarbeiterbeteiligung gibt mir das Gef√ºhl, Teil von etwas Gr√∂√üerem zu sein. Es ist motivierend zu wissen, dass mein Einsatz anerkannt und belohnt wird. Besonders erfreulich ist, dass die Howden-Mitarbeiteraktie bisher j√§hrlich einen ordentlichen Zuwachs erzielt hat, was mir auch finanziell zugutekommt.‚Äú Wir freuen uns sehr auf die Zusendung Ihres Lebenslaufes an bewerbung@howdengroup.de. Auf ein Anschreiben k√∂nnen Sie gerne verzichten, wir lernen Sie lieber in einem pers√∂nlichen Gespr√§ch kennen. Auch wenn Ihr Werdegang nicht exakt unseren Vorgaben entspricht, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung. Die Howden Deutschland AG ermutigt ausdr√ºcklich Menschen aller Nationalit√§ten, Geschlechter, Altersgruppen, sexueller Orientierungen sowie Personen mit Migrations- oder Fluchtgeschichte zur Bewerbung. Bewerbungen von Menschen mit anerkannter Schwerbehinderung werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt ber√ºcksichtigt. Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager
Description: About BYD Our Purpose is to build a zero-emission future that reconnects humanity with nature. We are looking for talent that connects with this mission and want to create positive impact by joining a diverse and dynamic team. BYD is a leading, high-tech multinational, based in Shenzhen, China. Operates in four core fields of IT, automotive, new energy, and rail transit and employs over 300,000 people worldwide. As a global pioneer in New Energy Solutions BYD is dedicated to building a zero-emission ecosystem. BYD Europe BV located in Schiedam, Netherlands is the marketing and sales HQ of BYD Co., Ltd based in Shenzhen, China. BYD Europe BV offers a full line of BYD electric vehicles, including all-electric cars, all-electric buses, and all-electric forklift trucks. About BYD Germany BYD Germany is the German National Sales Company of BYD Europe and BYD Company Ltd, a global leader in green energy and electric mobility solutions. BYD Germany offers a range of electric vehicles, including passenger cars, buses, and commercial vehicles. The company is expanding its operations in Germany to support the growing demand for new energy vehicles. Key Responsibilities: Support in managing the entire process of company cars, including various types such as Company Cars, Employee Cars, Press Fleet, Marketing Fleet, and Key Account Fleet etc. Assist the BYD European Demo Car Team with various tasks in Germany. Coordinate with both internal departments (such as vehicle procurement and disposition) and external entities (such as vehicle registration, insurance, and charging card providers). Collaborate with the team to plan and organize events. Handle daily administrative tasks such as managing documents, vehicle keys, and charging cards. Responsible for checking vehicles in and out of the pool. Create evaluations and reports by using Excel. Other ad-hoc tasks. Skills, Qualifications, and Experience Required: 5 years of relevant experience. Exceptional communication skills, verbal and written. Excellent in English and German language skills, Chinese would be an advantage . Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Suite, good skills with power point. Knowledge of modern archiving and documentation methods. Highly motivated and confident with a high level of accuracy. Able to multi-task, aim to target and can work under pressure. We Offer: Competitive remuneration based on performance and experience. Opportunities for department and company-wide team building events. A chance to contribute to the transition towards zero-emission transportation and the decarbonization of the economy. Our Purpose is to build a zero - emission future that reconnects humanity with nature and a World of clean air. We are looking for talent that connects with this mission and want to create positive impact by joining a diverse and dynamic team üåè Show more Show less

Description: SPEED & SPIRIT is what we look for in our candidates, defined by some simple values that inspire us to BE DRIVEN in our performance, BE VIBRANT in our sporting legacy, BE TOGETHER in our team spirit, and BE YOU to let our individual talent and experience shine. PUMA supports over 19,000 employees across 120+ countries. The PUMA Group owns the brand PUMA, Cobra Golf and stichd, and is headquartered in Herzogenaurach, Germany. Title: Senior Manager International Controlling
Description: SPEED & SPIRIT is what we look for in our candidates, defined by some simple values that inspire us to BE DRIVEN in our performance, BE VIBRANT in our sporting legacy, BE TOGETHER in our team spirit, and BE YOU to let our individual talent and experience shine. YOUR MISSION: Responsibility of an independent subgroup or region in all Controlling relevant matters Act as business partner for Region and Area Controllers and their CFO Analysis and summary of monthly results for the subgroup or region Collaboration in the creation and analysis of budgets, forecasts and strategic planning Participation in the annual and semi-annual financial statements process Implementation and optimization of reporting instruments and reporting standards in the subsidiaries within the affiliated group Support and collaboration in internal and cross functional projects Ad-hoc analysis. YOUR TALENT: University degree in Business Administration with a major in Finance / Controlling Minimum of 5 years of work experience in International Controlling / Financial Controlling Proficient in financial accounting practices compliant with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) Strong skills in Financial Planning Expertise in financial consolidation and tax law Excellent MS Office skills with a particular expertise in Excel Experience in project management Knowledge in Oracle Applications (Oracle HFM, Oracle EPM Planning) is a plus Excellent verbal and written communication in business English Dynamic, communicative and target-oriented teamplayer Strong logical and analytical thinking capabilities, along with excellent organizational skills and flexibility. PUMA supports over 19,000 employees across 120+ countries. The PUMA Group owns the brand PUMA, Cobra Golf and stichd, and is headquartered in Herzogenaurach, Germany. PUMA provides equal opportunities for all job applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or disability. Title: B√ºroassistenz
Description: Das Projekt ‚ÄûMennonitische Akademie‚Äú ist ein neues Projekt innerhalb der Arbeitsstelle Theologie der Friedenskirchen (ATF) und dient der Entwicklung einer gemeinsamen Lehr- und Forschungsplattform zum gemeinsamen Wissenstransfer in die √ñffentlichkeit. Die ATF lehrt und forscht zu ethischen und theologischen Fragen rund um Frieden und Gerechtigkeit ‚Äì mit einem Fokus auf die historischen Friedenskirchen, aber immer auch mit Blick auf Herausforderungen und Konflikte unserer Zeit. Dabei legt die ATF besonderen Wert auf Teamgeist und Kreativit√§t, um diesen Themenschwerpunkt in den Fachbereich Ev. Theologie, aber auch in zahlreiche interdisziplin√§re und au√üeruniversit√§re Kontexte hineinzutragen. Weitere Informationen zur ATF sind auf unserer Webseite zu finden. Aufgabengebiet allgemeine Verwaltungs- und B√ºrot√§tigkeiten: u. a. Post- und E-Mailbearbeitung auf Deutsch und Englisch, Terminkoordination, E-Mail-Verteiler pflegen Sachbearbeitung im Bereich Organisation- und Finanzangelegenheiten: verschiedene Finanzangelegenheiten eigenst√§ndig vorbereiten, √ºberwachen und abrechnen, Leitung in der Finanz- und Budgetverwaltung unterst√ºtzen bei der Entwicklung des Projektes unterst√ºtzen: u. a. durch Pflege der Webseite, Protokollf√ºhrung bei Planungstreffen, mit den verschiedenen Kooperationspartner:innen korrespondieren, Sitzungsvorbereitungen Einstellungsvoraussetzung abgeschlossene Ausbildung in einem kaufm√§nnischen oder verwaltenden Beruf oder gleichwertige F√§higkeiten, Erfahrungen und Qualifikationen Bei den letztgenannten Einstellungsvoraussetzungen erfolgt die Pr√ºfung der gleichwertigen F√§higkeiten, Erfahrungen und Qualifikationen mit der Einstellung. Erforderliche Fachkenntnisse und pers√∂nliche F√§higkeiten fundiertes Wissen im Bereich der B√ºro- und Verwaltungsarbeiten Erfahrungen in der effizienten Gestaltung von B√ºro- und Verwaltungsabl√§ufen sichere Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von MS Office-Programmen sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (Muttersprache oder mind. C1, w√ºnschenswert C2) gute Englischkenntnisse (mind. abgeschlossenes B1, w√ºnschenswert B2) Kenntnisse von Verwaltungsvorg√§ngen an einer Hochschule sind w√ºnschenswert freundliches, sicheres und verbindliches Auftreten gute Kommunikationsf√§higkeit und Serviceorientierung sehr gutes Organisationsverm√∂gen und Zeitmanagement Teamf√§higkeit hohes Ma√ü an Eigeninitiative Wir bieten Ihnen Sichere Verg√ºtung nach Tarif Weiterbildungs¬≠m√∂glichkeiten Betriebliche Alters¬≠vorsorge Attraktive Lage Flexible Arbeitszeiten M√∂glichkeiten zur Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie Gesundheitsmanagement, EGYM Wellpass Besch√§ftigten-Laptop Mobiles Arbeiten Bildungsurlaub 30 Tage Urlaub/Jahr Die Exzellenzuniversit√§t Hamburg geh√∂rt zu den forschungsst√§rksten Wissenschafts- und Bildungseinrichtungen Deutschlands. Durch Forschung und Lehre, Bildung und Wissenstransfer auf h√∂chstem Niveau f√∂rdern wir die Entwicklung einer neuen Generation verantwortungsbewusster Weltb√ºrger:innen, die den globalen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit gewachsen ist. Mit unserem Leitmotiv ‚ÄûInnovating and Cooperating for a Sustainable Future in a Digital Age‚Äú gestalten wir die Zusammenarbeit mit wissenschaftlichen und au√üerwissenschaftlichen Partnerinstitutionen in der Metropolregion Hamburg und weltweit. Wir laden Sie ein, Teil unserer Gemeinschaft zu werden, um gemeinsam mit uns einen nachhaltigen und digitalen Wandel f√ºr eine dynamische und pluralistische Gesellschaft zu gestalten. Die FHH f√∂rdert die Gleichstellung von Frauen und M√§nnern. Wir fordern M√§nner gem. 7 Abs. 1 des Hamburgischen Gleichstellungsgesetzes (HmbGleiG) daher ausdr√ºcklich auf, sich zu bewerben. Sie werden bei gleicher Eignung, Bef√§higung und fachlicher Leistung vorrangig ber√ºcksichtigt. Wir begr√º√üen ausdr√ºcklich die Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Migrationshintergrund. Schwerbehinderte und ihnen gleichgestellte behinderte Menschen haben Vorrang vor gesetzlich nicht bevorrechtigten bewerbenden Personen gleicher Eignung, Bef√§higung und fachlicher Leistung. C1, w√ºnschenswert C2) gute Englischkenntnisse (mind. abgeschlossenes B1, w√ºnschenswert B2) Kenntnisse von Verwaltungsvorg√§ngen an einer Hochschule sind w√ºnschenswert freundliches, sicheres und verbindliches Auftreten gute Kommunikationsf√§higkeit und Serviceorientierung sehr gutes Organisationsverm√∂gen und Zeitmanagement Teamf√§higkeit hohes Ma√ü an Eigeninitiative Wir bieten Ihnen Sichere Verg√ºtung nach Tarif Weiterbildungs¬≠m√∂glichkeiten Betriebliche Alters¬≠vorsorge Attraktive Lage Flexible Arbeitszeiten M√∂glichkeiten zur Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie Gesundheitsmanagement, EGYM Wellpass Besch√§ftigten-Laptop Mobiles Arbeiten Bildungsurlaub 30 Tage Urlaub/Jahr Die Exzellenzuniversit√§t Hamburg geh√∂rt zu den forschungsst√§rksten Wissenschafts- und Bildungseinrichtungen Deutschlands. Post- und E-Mailbearbeitung auf Deutsch und Englisch, Terminkoordination, E-Mail-Verteiler pflegen Sachbearbeitung im Bereich Organisation- und Finanzangelegenheiten: verschiedene Finanzangelegenheiten eigenst√§ndig vorbereiten, √ºberwachen und abrechnen, Leitung in der Finanz- und Budgetverwaltung unterst√ºtzen bei der Entwicklung des Projektes unterst√ºtzen: u. a. durch Pflege der Webseite, Protokollf√ºhrung bei Planungstreffen, mit den verschiedenen Kooperationspartner:innen korrespondieren, Sitzungsvorbereitungen Einstellungsvoraussetzung abgeschlossene Ausbildung in einem kaufm√§nnischen oder verwaltenden Beruf oder gleichwertige F√§higkeiten, Erfahrungen und Qualifikationen Bei den letztgenannten Einstellungsvoraussetzungen erfolgt die Pr√ºfung der gleichwertigen F√§higkeiten, Erfahrungen und Qualifikationen mit der Einstellung. Durch Forschung und Lehre, Bildung und Wissenstransfer auf h√∂chstem Niveau f√∂rdern wir die Entwicklung einer neuen Generation verantwortungsbewusster Weltb√ºrger:innen, die den globalen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit gewachsen ist. Schwerbehinderte und ihnen gleichgestellte behinderte Menschen haben Vorrang vor gesetzlich nicht bevorrechtigten bewerbenden Personen gleicher Eignung, Bef√§higung und fachlicher Leistung. Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant to Founders ‚Äì Real Estate Firm | Berlin Hauser Recruiting is delighted to partner with a prestigious real estate firm with stunning offices in Berlin. We are seeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide first-class support to the Founders, who travel extensively across Europe and require seamless assistance. This is a dynamic role for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and is passionate about excellence in executive support. You must be able to work interchangeably in English & German. On offer is a hugely generous salary and bonus, hybrid working model, team events and much more! Duties will include: Full Diary & Complex Travel Management ‚Äì Take complete ownership of the Founders' schedules, ensuring seamless coordination, anticipating challenges, and providing solutions proactively. Event & Project Coordination ‚Äì Arranging local / international team & industry events. Strategic Administrative Support ‚Äì Managing correspondence, meeting action points, preparing reports, expenses, invoice payments. Client & Partner Liaison ‚Äì Serve as the primary point of contact, maintaining relationships and ensuring flawless communication. Light Personal Support - Handle some personal administration, on occasion. What You‚Äôll Need: Experience supporting busy Executives or High-Net-Worth-Individuals with complex scheduling and international travel. High aptitude for logistics management and ability to deal with last minute changes calmly, under pressure. Ability to work full-time (40-hour contract) with the flexibility to respond to urgent needs outside typical working hours, particularly when the Founders are at peak business times. A passion for executive support, bringing enthusiasm, precision, and a proactive approach to daily operations. Excellent business communication skills in both German & English. The ability to work autonomously while working seamlessly with other managers and employees in the office. This is an exceptional opportunity for a top-tier EA to join a prestigious firm and contribute to its continued success. The role is to start ASAP - don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Office Services Assistant
Description: Who You'll Work With You are someone who thrives in a high-performance environment, bringing a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle meaningful challenges that have a real impact. In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we‚Äôll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities to help you quickly broaden your expertise, grow into a well-rounded professional, and contribute to work that truly makes a difference. When you join us, you will have: Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey. A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes. Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Exceptional benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family. Your Impact McKinsey is a global business consultancy that helps organizations achieve sustainable, inclusive growth. We work with clients in the private, public, and social sectors to solve complex problems and create positive change for all involved. We combine bold strategies and transformative technologies to help companies innovate more sustainably, achieve lasting performance improvements, and build workforces that will thrive for this generation and the next. In Germany and Austria, McKinsey has offices in Berlin, D√ºsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Cologne, Munich, Stuttgart, and Vienna. Globally, McKinsey teams work in more than 130 cities and 65 countries. At McKinsey, people with diverse career backgrounds work together. In Office Management, they include former translators, flight attendants, and hotel managers. As part of our three-person reception team, you will be the first point of contact in our Berlin office. You will quickly and flexibly help with all organizational tasks and ensure the seamless processing of our services. Among other responsibilities, you will manage room reservations for meetings, ensure optimal room planning, and make sure that every event room is equipped with the required technology. You will competently support colleagues and visitors from Germany and abroad before and after meetings ‚Äì and provide reliable information at all times. At our switchboard, you will take phone calls and forward them to the correct contact person. In Facility Management, you will assist with various office projects, such as coordinating appointments with suppliers, supporting them during visits, creating key figure analyses, and preparing presentations and meeting minutes. You will also be responsible for administration and organization in the mailroom, including processing incoming and outgoing mail and providing office supplies and IT equipment. In addition, you will take on administrative tasks and process invoices for external services. From the outset, you will take on responsibility for your own special tasks. Together with the team, you will further enhance the high-quality standards of our office. With us, you will find challenging tasks in an exceptionally committed team, with many opportunities for further training and great scope for personal development. In addition to modern offices in exclusive locations and state-of-the-art equipment, we offer other interesting benefits (e.g., free meals) and company-supported health management (e.g., sports offerings). Performance-based compensation and attractive social benefits round out our offer. The position is initially for a fixed term of two years. Your Qualifications and Skills You have completed your commercial professional training, e.g., as a hotel manager, ideally from a reputable hotel business. You have initial experience of reception work, in the hotel industry or in other service industry areas. You demonstrate strong service orientation and an aptitude for dealing with people. You think and act in a structured and conscientious manner and possess excellent communication and teamwork skills. You have excellent organizational skills and can set appropriate priorities. You are reliable and flexible, quick to grasp new concepts, and have good judgment. With your positive demeanor, you remain calm and maintain oversight even in hectic situations. You are fluent in German, have excellent written and spoken English skills, and are experienced at using standard Microsoft Office applications. Ideally, you have a technical understanding and aptitude, enabling you to quickly familiarize yourself with new technologies. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant (m/f/d) Private Equity Firm Munich A global private equity firm in central Munich with a strong team of Assistants is seeking 2 new Executive Assistants / Team Assistants to support investment professionals in a busy firm. These are full secretarial & administrative roles, requiring a strong team player who enjoys working at a fast pace. You must have worked in an international firm or in 5-star hospitality in a support role, for example on reception, administration or events, and speak German & English to a fluent level - this is essential for this role! This firm offers incredible benefits to their employees, in terms of remuneration, well-being, opportunity to travel and work in their European offices, and career progression. They will support you by helping with relocation costs if you are moving to Munich. THE FIRM My client is a global investment firm with offices based in the heart of Munich and all across Europe, Asia and North America. They pride themselves on their values: being respectful, friendly, entrepreneurial, and they operate across a very flat structure. They only invest into firms that will do good, and firms with values aligned to their own, and they are very charitable and care about sustainability (and can prove it!) making this a very special place to work. This is a hugely supportive and collaborative environment, with encouragement to learn more and develop your skill set. THE ROLE You will support 3-5 investment professionals of varying seniority, and you're encouraged to take on wider projects if you would like to. The main duties are: Managing multiple diaries and arranging meetings across time zones Coordinating and booking international travel with often complex itineraries and last minute changes Processing expenses Replying to emails in German and English on behalf of the team Document management (signatures, printing, binding) Occasional event organisation for the local teams Anything ad-hoc that's needed to ensure the job gets done THE CANDIDATE This is an environment that values team work and you must enjoy working in a team. They look for very humble, intelligent, professional and friendly candidates who enjoy a fast paced environment and who want to learn, not afraid to ask questions. To be successful in this role, you must: Be service-oriented, with some experience in a similar administrative or organisational role, or have worked in hospitality / events Possess fluent German and English language skills Be able to build professional relationships Have the ability to prioritise and handle multiple requests Be resilient and calm when there are last-minute changes Be a team player Have a high level of accuracy and attention to detail Have good knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Value the role of an Assistant THE PACKAGE On top of a competitive base salary (in line with experience) there are the following benefits: Hugely generous performance-related bonus Annual salary review Company pay into a private pension Wellness benefits including gym membership Travel to work paid for Mobile phone for business and personal use Home office budget Annual Christmas & Summer parties in Munich & London Annual ski conference Free food and drinks all day, lunch cooked for you onsite 30 days' holiday, plus public holidays Relocation support if you are moving to Munich! If this is for you, please apply today! Show more Show less

Title: Administrative Assistant
Description: PIMCO is a global leader in active fixed income with deep expertise across public and private markets. We invest our clients‚Äô capital across a range of fixed income and credit opportunities, leveraging our decades of experience navigating complex debt markets. Our flexible capital base and deep relationships with issuers have helped us become one of the world‚Äôs largest providers of traditional and nontraditional solutions for companies that need financing and investors who seek strong risk-adjusted returns. Since 1971, our people have shaped our organization through a high-performance inclusive culture, in which we celebrate diverse thinking. We invest in our people and strive to imprint our CORE values of Collaboration, Openness, Responsibility and Excellence. We believe each of us is here to help others succeed and this has led to PIMCO being recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients. Position Description The Assistant will provide high-level support to a team of Investment Professionals throughout PIMCO Munich with their duties to include but not limited to: Proactively planning schedules and itineraries to take into account multiple time zones and conflicting calendars Extensive diary management, answering telephone calls and responding to ad hoc requests. Coordination of extensive travel bookings: flights, trains, visas and hotel accommodation. Open Zoom calls/meetings and ensure meeting rooms are prepared ahead of schedule Ad hoc projects to meet with the demands of the business Requirements This position requires a highly organized and flexible individual to work in a fast-paced environment managing a consistent high volume of work. Please submit CVs in English. Title: Receptionist
Description: About TELUS Digital TELUS Digital focuses on the value of human connection to design, build and deliver high-tech, high-touch customer experiences powered by next-gen digital solutions. With over 50,000 team members and supporting 50+ languages in twenty (20) Countries across North and Central America, Europe and Asia, TELUS Digital empowers customer experience innovation through digital enablement, spirited teamwork, agile thinking and a caring culture that puts customers first. The company's solutions cover customer experience, digital transformation, IT lifecycle, advisory and digital consulting, risk and back-office support. Fueling any stage of company growth, TELUS Digital partners with some of the world‚Äôs most disruptive brands from fast-growing tech, financial services, fintech, gaming, travel & hospitality and healthcare industries. TELUS holds a 65% interest in TELUS Digital with Baring Private Equity Asia holding the remaining 35%. Learn more at: telusdigital.com. Position Overview As a receptionist you will be the first point of contact for the company and you will provide administrative support across the organization. You will handle the flow of people through the business and ensure that all receptionist responsibilities are completed accurately and delivered with high quality and in a timely manner. Responsibilities: Welcomes all visitors to TELUS Digital by greeting them, in person or on the telephone in a warm and friendly manner; and announcing them appropriately, answering or referring inquiries Directs visitors by maintaining employee and department directories; giving instructions Maintains security by following procedures and controlling access; monitoring logbook; issuing visitor badges Maintains telecommunication system by following manufacturer's instructions for house phone and console operation Maintains safe and clean reception area by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations. Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Manage reception meeting room bookings Supports the leadership team with any important client/ VIP visits to the building Performs other clerical receptionist duties such as filing, photocopying, collating, faxing etc. Liaise with all other departments, our Finance team in particular to raise, maintain and receipt purchase orders as required Perform additional duties such as Team Member directory upkeep Assist in the deployment, collection and management of TELUS Digital assets Ordering taxis for visitors, if requested by management Requirements: Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite Professional appearance Third-level education Must be available to support reception operational hours between 6am -9pm Monday ‚Äì Friday, on a full-time basis (40 hours per week) Previous experience in a customer-facing role essential Self-starting attitude and self-motivation Responsible and initiative Dynamic person It is advantageous for applicants to be a car owner and hold a full EU/UK Drivers‚Äô License Competencies: Solid communication skills both written and verbal Ability to be resourceful and proactive in dealing with issues that may arise Ability to organise, multitask, prioritise and work under pressure TELUS Digital recognizes and embraces the importance of values in our ever-changing workplace. To be successful, all candidates must demonstrate behaviors that are reflective of our values: We embrace change and initiate opportunity We have a passion for growth We believe in spirited teamwork We have the courage to innovate At TELUS Digital, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. Wir verpflichten uns, Personen mit einem Schutzstatus, zum Beispiel Behinderung und Veteranenstatus, oder einem anderen gesetzlich gesch√ºtzten Status nicht zu diskriminieren. In mehr als 100 preisgekr√∂nten H√§usern weltweit schaffen die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter des The Ritz-Carlton so au√üergew√∂hnliche Erlebnisse, dass diese G√§sten noch lange nach dem Aufenthalt in Erinnerung bleiben. Wir sprechen die international besten Hotellerie-Profis an, die Erinnerungen f√ºr ein Leben kreieren, und sind davon √ºberzeugt, dass jeder erfolgreich sein kann, wenn er die M√∂glichkeit hat, kreativ, durchdacht und mitf√ºhlend zu handeln. Jeden Tag setzen wir international Standards f√ºr besonders luxuri√∂sen Service, wie man ihn heute selten findet. Und wir sind stolz darauf, unseren G√§sten herausragende F√ºrsorge und Komfort zu bieten. Ihre Rolle besteht darin, daf√ºr Sorge zu tragen, dass die "Goldstandards" von The Ritz-Carlton jeden Tag anmutig und durchdacht erf√ºllt werden. Title: Administrative Assistant For Office In Munich
Description: At F5, we strive to bring a better digital world to life. Our teams empower organizations across the globe to create, secure, and run applications that enhance how we experience our evolving digital world. We are passionate about cybersecurity, from protecting consumers from fraud to enabling companies to focus on innovation. Everything we do centers around people. That means we obsess over how to make the lives of our customers, and their customers, better. And it means we prioritize a diverse F5 community where each individual can thrive. We value our employees and act in a team-oriented and innovative manner. We emphasize diversity and think globally. Reliability, trustworthiness, and openness are important to us, as well as a high level of integrity. Overview: This position is an all-rounder role that is entrusted with independent tasks handling and projects within its competencies. You will take responsibility for a wide and interesting range of tasks in an international company and you will support the Regional Sales Vice President with administrative and organizational tasks as well as manage our Munich office. Your Tasks: Manage the reception, including the central telephone for the Munich office Support our Regional Sales Vice President with administrative and operational tasks (travel expense management, travel management, meeting minutes, independent coordination and arrangement of visits from international guests, organization of company events, appointment coordination) Manage the marketing storage and ensure timely shipping of marketing items to event locations, order management for marketing items in alignment with the marketing team Handle office management tasks: email management, document maintenance (contracts, orders, telephone lists, etc.), ordering and managing office supplies Be the first point of contact for our guests Planning and execution of organizational tasks for events, seminars, conferences and meetings Create cost statements Facility management and coordination of facility tasks with external service providers Take responsibility for all health and safety issues (first aid, fire protection) in the office, as well as reporting accidents Prepare meeting and office rooms and ensure a representative appearance, manage room bookings Collaborate and align with various departments such as sales, marketing, finance, and IT Your Profile: You have excellent and verifiable skills in planning, organization, and administration You work very independently, proactively, and reliably Excellent written and verbal communication skills Very good German and English language skills Advanced knowledge of Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Internet High service orientation & flexibility Team orientation Experience with safety regulations (first aid, fire protection) is an advantage Very good skills in prioritizing many different tasks Proactivity, solution orientation, and very good skills in dealing with various parties (employees, managers, guests, service providers) Existing first aid training or willingness to undergo training The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change. Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com) . Equal Employment Opportunity It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. F5 offers a variety of reasonable accommodations for candidates. Requesting an accommodation is completely voluntary. F5 will assess the need for accommodations in the application process separately from those that may be needed to perform the job. Request by contacting accommodations@f5.com. Show more Show less

Title: Office Coordinator - Part-Time
Description: Office Coordinator - Part-time, Fixed-term (m/w/d) Hybrid working in Frankfurt (at least 2 days in the office per week) The company: Imagine a world where every small business has the power to thrive. That's the world we're building at iwoca. Small businesses aren't just statistics ‚Äì they're the heartbeat of our communities, the character of our high streets, and the engine of our economy. Since 2012, we've revolutionised how these businesses access finance, turning what was once a lengthy, frustrating process into something remarkable: funding that's fast, flexible, and actually works for modern businesses. Our impact speaks for itself: we've provided billions in funding to over 150,000 businesses across Europe, making us one of the continent's leading fintech innovators. But we're just getting started. Our mission? To empower one million businesses with the financial tools they deserve. We combine cutting-edge technology and data science with genuine human understanding to make finance feel less like a barrier and more like a superpower. Whether it's managing cash flow or seizing unexpected opportunities, we ensure businesses get the funds they need ‚Äì often within minutes. The role: This is an exciting opportunity to join our team as an Office Coordinator with our People Operations team, on a part-time basis (15 hours/week, fixed-term 12 months). You will play a key role in creating a welcoming and efficient work environment across our Frankfurt and Berlin offices. Frankfurt will be your main focus, as Berlin is located in a managed shared office space, with lower maintenance requirements. As the go-to person for our teams in both locations, you will ensure smooth day-to-day operations and a positive experience for everyone. You will report directly to our People & Culture Partner for Team DE. We offer flexibility in working arrangements (e.g., two full days or three mornings), depending on what works best for both you and the team. Serve as the first point of contact for office-related topics and queries from the Frankfurt and Berlin teams. Manage regular orders for food & drink and office supplies, ensuring adequate stock levels in both offices. Fostering an environment of collaboration and connection by organising team events. Manage shopping and catering for events in both locations. Serve as the primary contact for Frankfurt and Berlin offices, managing communications with external providers, including landlords, cleaning, supplies, equipment, invoices, and errands. Liaising with the Frankfurt and Berlin teams and HR to ensure new joiners and visitors are welcomed to our office and well looked after. Proactively gather ideas and recommendations to continuously improve our office environment and processes. Play a key role in shaping the Frankfurt office and team culture following our recent move into a beautiful new office space in the city centre, including finalising topics like soundproofing, design, and storage solutions. Support the People & Culture Partner with Health & Safety topics on the ground. Provide occasional IT support for new starters and daily operations, such as desk setup, accessory management, onboarding kit preparation, and on-site issue resolution. The requirements: Preferably some previous working experience in office management or a similar administrative role. Strong organisational and multitasking skills with the ability to prioritise tasks effectively and manage time efficiently. A confident and enthusiastic attitude that thrives in a regularly changing and fast-paced environment. An independent, proactive, and reliable way of working to effectively manage the needs of both offices. Excellent communication skills, with a strong command of German and fluency in English (written and spoken), to facilitate seamless communication with our international team. Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve office-related issues quickly and effectively. The salary We expect to pay from ‚Ç¨30.000 - ‚Ç¨35.000 for this role (full-time equivalent). But, we‚Äôre open-minded, so definitely include your salary goals with your application. We routinely benchmark salaries against market rates, and run quarterly performance and salary reviews. The culture At iwoca, we prioritise a culture of learning, growth, and support, and invest in the professional development of our team members. We value diversity in thought and skill, and encourage you to explore new areas of interest to help us improve our products and services. The offices We put a lot of effort into making iwoca a brilliant place to work: Offices in London, Leeds, Berlin, and Frankfurt with plenty of drinks and snacks Events and clubs, like bingo, comedy nights, yoga classes, football, etc. The Benefits A smart, motivated and international team (we represent over 35 different nationalities) with ridiculous growth-mindset iwoca takes over a ski chalet in winter so that you and your team can ski or snowboard (and work) for a week. During summer we are drawn to the sun. Access to the gym membership program Exclusive participation in the daily commute Our home is in a nice office in the heart of the big city. In Frankfurt city centre, directly next to the famous Fressgass. Our office in Berlin is located centrally in the Hackesche H√∂fe. Company-wide training courses with internal and external speakers 26 days of vacation a year plus a free day for your birthday One-month fully paid sabbatical after 4 years Share options A paid volunteer day that gives you the opportunity to invest time to support a charity of your choice. ‚Äôiwocans‚Äô also benefit from fully stocked fridges in our offices with whatever is needed to strengthen them. There are snacks (both healthy and less healthy) for the whole day. Compensation Range: ‚Ç¨30K - ‚Ç¨35K Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant to Founders ‚Äì Real Estate Firm | Berlin Hauser Recruiting is delighted to partner with a prestigious real estate firm with stunning offices in Berlin. We are seeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide first-class support to the Founders, who travel extensively across Europe and require seamless assistance. This is a dynamic role for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and is passionate about excellence in executive support. You must be able to work interchangeably in English & German. On offer is a hugely generous salary and bonus, hybrid working model, team events and much more! Duties will include: Full Diary & Complex Travel Management ‚Äì Take complete ownership of the Founders' schedules, ensuring seamless coordination, anticipating challenges, and providing solutions proactively. Event & Project Coordination ‚Äì Arranging local / international team & industry events. Strategic Administrative Support ‚Äì Managing correspondence, meeting action points, preparing reports, expenses, invoice payments. Client & Partner Liaison ‚Äì Serve as the primary point of contact, maintaining relationships and ensuring flawless communication. Light Personal Support - Handle some personal administration, on occasion. What You‚Äôll Need: Experience supporting busy Executives or High-Net-Worth-Individuals with complex scheduling and international travel. High aptitude for logistics management and ability to deal with last minute changes calmly, under pressure. Ability to work full-time (40-hour contract) with the flexibility to respond to urgent needs outside typical working hours, particularly when the Founders are at peak business times. A passion for executive support, bringing enthusiasm, precision, and a proactive approach to daily operations. Excellent business communication skills in both German & English. The ability to work autonomously while working seamlessly with other managers and employees in the office. This is an exceptional opportunity for a top-tier EA to join a prestigious firm and contribute to its continued success. The role is to start ASAP - don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant to Founders ‚Äì Real Estate Firm | Berlin Hauser Recruiting is delighted to partner with a prestigious real estate firm with stunning offices in Berlin. We are seeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide first-class support to the Founders, who travel extensively across Europe and require seamless assistance. This is a dynamic role for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and is passionate about excellence in executive support. You must be able to work interchangeably in English & German. On offer is a hugely generous salary and bonus, hybrid working model, team events and much more! Duties will include: Full Diary & Complex Travel Management ‚Äì Take complete ownership of the Founders' schedules, ensuring seamless coordination, anticipating challenges, and providing solutions proactively. Event & Project Coordination ‚Äì Arranging local / international team & industry events. Strategic Administrative Support ‚Äì Managing correspondence, meeting action points, preparing reports, expenses, invoice payments. Client & Partner Liaison ‚Äì Serve as the primary point of contact, maintaining relationships and ensuring flawless communication. Light Personal Support - Handle some personal administration, on occasion. What You‚Äôll Need: Experience supporting busy Executives or High-Net-Worth-Individuals with complex scheduling and international travel. High aptitude for logistics management and ability to deal with last minute changes calmly, under pressure. Ability to work full-time (40-hour contract) with the flexibility to respond to urgent needs outside typical working hours, particularly when the Founders are at peak business times. A passion for executive support, bringing enthusiasm, precision, and a proactive approach to daily operations. Excellent business communication skills in both German & English. The ability to work autonomously while working seamlessly with other managers and employees in the office. This is an exceptional opportunity for a top-tier EA to join a prestigious firm and contribute to its continued success. The role is to start ASAP - don't delay your application! Show more Show less
