Title: Executive Assistant
Description: One of Hauser Recruiting's new clients - a European investment firm - has recently opened their new modern office in prime location in Frankfurt and they seek their first Executive Assistant / Office Manager. Fluency in German and advanced English language skills are essential! This is an established firm with offices throughout Europe, and a start-up feel in Frankfurt. This will suit you if you are an Executive Assistant or Team Assistant, able & happy to work as the team's sole support, with a view to establishing structure. You will work closely with other European business support colleagues, manage the Frankfurt office, and set the standards for future members of the business support team. You should enjoy working in an environment that changes constantly, and no two days will be the same! You should be happy supporting the whole team. My client has plans to double the number of employees in the next year - an exciting time to join in this period of company growth! Because you are responsible for the office as well as providing EA support, this role is office-based 5 days per week. This could be more flexible when the business support team grows. If this is an opportunity that suits your career motivators, what skills should you bring to be considered for the role? Proven history in a European or global financial services / investment business Experience as a Team Assistant or Executive Assistant with diverse duties including diary management, travel organisation, expenses, administration & some office management tasks Advanced, confident communication skills in English & fluency in German - essential Well-structured and independent working style Proactive support, taking on small and large tasks without differentiation Ability to multi-task Ideally some experience of organising team events If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Team Assistant - stunning, centrally located Frankfurt office! THE CLIENT Our client is a successful, independent investment firm operating across Europe. With a modern, centrally located office in Frankfurt, they operate with a collaborative tight-knit, high-performing team. As the firm continues to grow, they are looking for a reliable and proactive Team Assistant & Receptionist to provide full operational and front-office support to their Frankfurt team. THE ROLE Working alongside a wonderfully supportive Office Manager, the role will be hands-on and varied ideal for someone with a collaborative mindset. As the Team Assistant & Receptionist, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in keeping the office running smoothly, managing travel, events, and day-to-day coordination. You‚Äôll be the face of the office and a vital support to the wider team ‚Äî it‚Äôs a great opportunity for someone who enjoys being a 'go to' person. Duties will include but are not limited to: Managing and coordinating calendars and travel (national and international) Booking and supporting meetings, video calls, and conference calls Processing expenses for the Frankfurt team Organising team events (e.g. off-sites, team days) Preparing and formatting documents and presentations (Word and PowerPoint) in both German and English Welcoming guests, setting up meeting rooms, and arranging catering Maintaining a presentable reception, kitchen, and communal area Handling daily post, filing, and general office admin Ordering supplies and managing stock inventory Covering for colleagues during holidays Reproducing and binding documents and presentation packs KEY REQUIREMENTS 3+ years‚Äô experience in a similar Team Assistant/Administrative role Fluent in German and English, both spoken and written Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel Excellent organisational and multitasking skills Friendly, dependable, and highly professional Strong attention to detail and the ability to follow procedures Proactive and enthusiastic with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude Confident communicator, able to liaise comfortably with internal and external stakeholders Experience working across multiple teams BENEFITS Hugely competitive salary and bonus potential, plus benefits including: ‚Ä¢ Annual discretionary bonus ‚Ä¢ 30 days‚Äô holiday ‚Ä¢ Job Ticket ‚Ä¢ Gym Membership ‚Ä¢ Bright, modern office in Frankfurt‚Äôs city centre ‚Ä¢ Flat hierarchy and agile working style ‚Ä¢ A positive team culture that encourages personal ownership and initiative Joss Search is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, passionately supporting and promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building an inclusive culture, respecting our individual differences and bringing our community together. Show more Show less

Title: Team Assistant
Description: Team Assistant Global Investment Bank Munich, Bavaria We have just picked up a fantastic opportunity to join a global investment bank in Munich! This role is a Team Assistant position joining the firm and another assistant to not support a managing director, but also take on some light office management duties. The team in Munich is absolutely incredible and they also love to get together for social and sporting events to keep the team spirit alive! The culture in this office is unmatched and perfect for someone who is keen to roll up their sleeves, bring energy and positive attitude to the office. German and English are essential in this role as you will be working closely together with other assistants across different offices. You will also get 1 day working from home and a incredible team of colleagues where you will be valued for your contribution! MAIN DUTIES: Assistant ‚Äì direct support to the Managing Partners & some more junior Investment Professionals based in Munich (full diary management, travel arrangements, secretarial & organisational support) Office Management ‚Äì overall responsibility for leading the office & ensuring the wider team is supported well and office is running smoothly. Projects ‚Äì assistance with events & process implementation This is a perfect role to take the next step in your career. The team are very welcoming and supportive, and would like to find a candidate the fits well within their culture. Being well organised with strong communication skills are key. Joss Search is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, passionately supporting and promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building an inclusive culture, respecting our individual differences and bringing our community together. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Responsibilities: The Executive Assistant (EA) provides project and business administration support to the search team in all aspects of the search process including: document preparation and management, scheduling and planning of candidate and client interviews and meetings, accounts receivable and accounts payable, expense reporting, correspondence and file management. An integral part of an EA‚Äôs role is problem solving within the search execution and administrative process. Specific Responsibilities: Responsible for the administration of the search process for all team search assignments Formatting, editing, proofreading, preparing and transmitting client deliverables Maintaining consultant calendar Preparing travel itineraries for the consultant, client or candidate in any part of the search process Supporting search team with account management and client relationship, including consultant expenses, client invoices/receivables and other financial reports Creating and maintaining an efficient file management and follow-up system for all search processes Maintaining client and candidate communications through scheduling and prioritizing telephone and email communication Verifying degrees of candidates Consistently building strong relationships and good rapport with candidates and clients Maintaining the accuracy, quality and integrity of all search information in the Heidrick & Struggles database Maintaining and developing job-related skills by attending Company learning programs and keeping up-to-date with job/industry-related reading Maintaining client, candidate and companywide confidentiality Contributing to the team and office by providing reception relief and back-up assistance to other EAs May assist with database research and coding of records in collaboration with Associate or Research Associate practice resources Qualifications: High school education required; college degree desired At least five years of administrative experience in roles requiring strong project coordination Demonstrate a business acumen and financial awareness Proficient knowledge of all Microsoft Office products. Minimum keyboarding skills of 60wpm. Experience with proprietary database environments, a plus Excellent communication skills‚Äîverbal, written and listening Experience dealing with people at all levels of an organization, getting and giving often complex and sensitive information in both verbal and written communications Professional services experience, a plus Fluency in both German and English Behavioral Competencies: External and internal awareness: Maintains personal contacts across the internal organization and appropriately shares information. Addresses business process issues proactively with other areas, as necessary Analytical Thinking: Develops frameworks to assure that ‚Äúpros‚Äù and ‚Äúcons‚Äù are evaluated, key issues are identified and detailed analysis is synthesized Creative Thinking: Sets a personal example of seeking out new and better ways of doing things Stays open to new ideas and approaches Generates new ideas Client orientation: Constantly hones understanding and responsiveness to internal and external client requirements, goals and issues Self-confidence and determination Manages most situations in a calm, steady, ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù manner Demonstrates self-confidence; resilient Demonstrates a focus on results over time; resourceful, tenacious Relationship building Takes the time to maintain relationships and create new ones Driving results: Manages projects, activities and resources according to search and team strategy effectively Sets priorities and reviews progress against goals regularly Multitasks effectively and efficiently Best practice perspective: Seeks to adopt best practices to increase effectiveness and organization competitiveness Eager to participate in the coaching and mentoring of new employees through formal and informal learning programs and relationships Possesses strong personal commitment to quality standards and meeting quality expectations Gives constructive feedback and recommends suggestions for improvement, where appropriate Organizational buy-in: Generates enthusiasm for Company strategies and key initiatives Energizes others with whom he/she is in regular contact Personal Characteristics Available to work Monday through Friday during normal office hours Demonstrates strong business ethics (honesty, integrity, confidentiality, discretion) in all situations Strong team player Maintains composure in fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Displays appropriate sense of humor in the workplace Flexible to work overtime, when needed Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Join our dynamic team in Munich as an Executive Assistant. MERMEC Deutschland is a dynamic and growing company in the rail sector. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and enjoy a variety of responsibilities, in a business unit in growth. We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to provide direct support to our executive management team, particularly the CEO. This role involves a mix of administrative, organizational, and communication responsibilities, requiring strong multitasking skills and discretion. Responsibilities: Provide high-level administrative support to the CEO and executive team Manage calendars, coordinate appointments, and schedule meetings Organize and book business travel (individual and group) Prepare meeting materials, presentations, and internal reports Follow up on meeting action points and deadlines Plan and support internal and external events Handle incoming calls and emails on behalf of the executives Liaise with internal departments and external partners as needed Qualifications: Completed commercial training or similar qualification Experience in executive assistance is an advantage Strong organizational and time-management skills Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities High discretion and sense of responsibility Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Fluent in German and English (written and spoken) Ability to work independently, flexibly, and reliably We are looking forward for you application! Title: Team Assistant

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: A rare opportunity for an Assistant seeking a varied and dynamic role in Frankfurt's Bankenviertel! It can't be overstated that every day working for this boutique investment firm will be different... This will suit you if you enjoy working in an everchanging environment, adapting to shifting priorities and have the ability to think outside the box. You must have fluent German & advanced English language skills. You'll work alongside the Office Manager / Senior Executive Assistant who is an expert in her field, with more than 20 years supporting at the most senior level, and she is keen to share information, help you to upskill and support your career development. She has a wonderful balance of professionalism and fun - and she's looking for a great teammate! In return, you'll be rewarded with a highly competitive salary, target-driven bonuses, career development and a role that will allow you to add real value. You will enjoy this role if you like working in a smaller (yet very chic!) office environment. This will be office-based 5 days per week during Probezeit, with home office opportunity upon successful completion. The Role You will support the Managing Director, and work very closely with the Senior Executive Assistant / Office Manager to support with office and project management. Core duties include: Calendar coordination & inbox management Travel arrangements Organisation of meetings Preparation of presentations Handling sensitive legal, financial & personnel documentation Expenses, invoicing Arranging events Ad-hoc projects Ensuring the smooth running of the office alongside the Office Manager Covering for the Office Manager when she is away To be considered for this role, these are essential skills and attributes: Demonstrate experience in high-level service-oriented environments (such as completed your Hotelfachfrau/mann Ausbildung in 5* hotels), or worked as an Assistant in a similar boutique environment Demonstrate previous experience working with high-net-worth individuals / senior executives Possess fluent German and advanced English skills Comprehensive MS Office knowledge Excellent organisational and administrative skills Enjoy and work well in an ever-changing environment with moving deadlines Ability to problem-solve and use initiative Possess a professional and calm demeanour Impeccable attention to detail Exercise discretion and confidentiality If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Office Services Assistant
Description: Who You'll Work With You are someone who thrives in a high-performance environment, bringing a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle meaningful challenges that have a real impact. In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we‚Äôll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities to help you quickly broaden your expertise, grow into a well-rounded professional, and contribute to work that truly makes a difference. When you join us, you will have: Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey. A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes. Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Exceptional benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family. Your Impact McKinsey is a global business consultancy that helps organizations achieve sustainable, inclusive growth. We work with clients in the private, public, and social sectors to solve complex problems and create positive change for all involved. We combine bold strategies and transformative technologies to help companies innovate more sustainably, achieve lasting performance improvements, and build workforces that will thrive for this generation and the next. In Germany and Austria, McKinsey has offices in Berlin, D√ºsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Cologne, Munich, Stuttgart, and Vienna. Globally, McKinsey teams work in more than 130 cities and 65 countries. At McKinsey, people with diverse career backgrounds work together. In Office Management, they include former translators, flight attendants, and hotel managers. As part of our three-person reception team, you will be the first point of contact in our Berlin office. You will quickly and flexibly help with all organizational tasks and ensure the seamless processing of our services. Among other responsibilities, you will manage room reservations for meetings, ensure optimal room planning, and make sure that every event room is equipped with the required technology. You will competently support colleagues and visitors from Germany and abroad before and after meetings ‚Äì and provide reliable information at all times. At our switchboard, you will take phone calls and forward them to the correct contact person. In Facility Management, you will assist with various office projects, such as coordinating appointments with suppliers, supporting them during visits, creating key figure analyses, and preparing presentations and meeting minutes. You will also be responsible for administration and organization in the mailroom, including processing incoming and outgoing mail and providing office supplies and IT equipment. In addition, you will take on administrative tasks and process invoices for external services. From the outset, you will take on responsibility for your own special tasks. Together with the team, you will further enhance the high-quality standards of our office. With us, you will find challenging tasks in an exceptionally committed team, with many opportunities for further training and great scope for personal development. In addition to modern offices in exclusive locations and state-of-the-art equipment, we offer other interesting benefits (e.g., free meals) and company-supported health management (e.g., sports offerings). Performance-based compensation and attractive social benefits round out our offer. The position is initially for a fixed term of two years. Your Qualifications and Skills You have completed your commercial professional training, e.g., as a hotel manager, ideally from a reputable hotel business. You have initial experience of reception work, in the hotel industry or in other service industry areas. You demonstrate strong service orientation and an aptitude for dealing with people. You think and act in a structured and conscientious manner and possess excellent communication and teamwork skills. You have excellent organizational skills and can set appropriate priorities. You are reliable and flexible, quick to grasp new concepts, and have good judgment. With your positive demeanor, you remain calm and maintain oversight even in hectic situations. You are fluent in German, have excellent written and spoken English skills, and are experienced at using standard Microsoft Office applications. Ideally, you have a technical understanding and aptitude, enabling you to quickly familiarize yourself with new technologies. Show more Show less

Title: Office Administrator
Description: Location: FibreCoat GmbH, Philipsstra√üe, 8, Aachen, Germany About FibreCoat: FibreCoat is an innovative and fast-growing start-up based in Aachen. We are pioneering high-performance materials that are affordable and sustainable. With a dynamic, international team and a results-driven culture, we are shaping the future of advanced materials for various industries. Job Description: As an Office Administrator at FibreCoat , you will play a key role in keeping our daily operations running smoothly. You will be responsible for supporting administrative processes, coordinating office activities, and assisting various departments to ensure an organised, efficient, and positive work environment. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys variety, takes initiative, and thrives in a growing, fast-paced company. Responsibilities Retrieve, open, and sort physical mail from designated mailboxes Distribute incoming correspondence to the appropriate team members Answer and screen incoming calls to the main office line Monitor, restock, and order kitchen and office supplies as needed Ensure the office and kitchen areas are tidy, organised, and visitor-ready Refill drinks and snacks in communal areas and meeting rooms Water indoor plants regularly to maintain a pleasant office atmosphere Liaise with the landlord to ensure cleaning services are carried out effectively Monitor and maintain general digital mailboxes Support the organisation of internal events Provide general support to the Administration team on day-to-day operations Qualifications Prior experience in office administration or a similar role is a plus Strong organisational and multitasking skills Proficient with MS Office and comfortable with digital tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German is a big plus) Friendly, reliable, and solution-oriented mindset Ability to multitask, organise, and prioritise work What We Offer: The chance to make a tangible impact on sustainable development and innovation in the high-performance materials industry A dynamic and diverse work environment with a collaborative international team Creative freedom and responsibility in a young and growing company Opportunities for personal and professional growth in a rapidly expanding market Competitive salary and benefits package ESOP options ( Employee Stock Ownership Plan ) A modern and welcoming office space Snack bar, team activities, and home office opportunities 30 vacation days per year Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant (m/f/d) Private Equity Firm Munich A global private equity firm in central Munich with a strong team of Assistants is seeking 2 new Executive Assistants / Team Assistants to support investment professionals in a busy firm. These are full secretarial & administrative roles, requiring a strong team player who enjoys working at a fast pace. You must have worked in an international firm or in 5-star hospitality in a support role, for example on reception, administration or events, and speak German & English to a fluent level - this is essential for this role! This firm offers incredible benefits to their employees, in terms of remuneration, well-being, opportunity to travel and work in their European offices, and career progression. They will support you by helping with relocation costs if you are moving to Munich. THE FIRM My client is a global investment firm with offices based in the heart of Munich and all across Europe, Asia and North America. They pride themselves on their values: being respectful, friendly, entrepreneurial, and they operate across a very flat structure. They only invest into firms that will do good, and firms with values aligned to their own, and they are very charitable and care about sustainability (and can prove it!) making this a very special place to work. This is a hugely supportive and collaborative environment, with encouragement to learn more and develop your skill set. THE ROLE You will support 3-5 investment professionals of varying seniority, and you're encouraged to take on wider projects if you would like to. The main duties are: Managing multiple diaries and arranging meetings across time zones Coordinating and booking international travel with often complex itineraries and last minute changes Processing expenses Replying to emails in German and English on behalf of the team Document management (signatures, printing, binding) Occasional event organisation for the local teams Anything ad-hoc that's needed to ensure the job gets done THE CANDIDATE This is an environment that values team work and you must enjoy working in a team. They look for very humble, intelligent, professional and friendly candidates who enjoy a fast paced environment and who want to learn, not afraid to ask questions. Title: Receptionist
Description: About TELUS Digital TELUS Digital focuses on the value of human connection to design, build and deliver high-tech, high-touch customer experiences powered by next-gen digital solutions. With over 50,000 team members and supporting 50+ languages in twenty (20) Countries across North and Central America, Europe and Asia, TELUS Digital empowers customer experience innovation through digital enablement, spirited teamwork, agile thinking and a caring culture that puts customers first. The company's solutions cover customer experience, digital transformation, IT lifecycle, advisory and digital consulting, risk and back-office support. Fueling any stage of company growth, TELUS Digital partners with some of the world‚Äôs most disruptive brands from fast-growing tech, financial services, fintech, gaming, travel & hospitality and healthcare industries. TELUS holds a 65% interest in TELUS Digital with Baring Private Equity Asia holding the remaining 35%. Learn more at: telusdigital.com. Position Overview As a receptionist you will be the first point of contact for the company and you will provide administrative support across the organization. You will handle the flow of people through the business and ensure that all receptionist responsibilities are completed accurately and delivered with high quality and in a timely manner. Responsibilities: Welcomes all visitors to TELUS Digital by greeting them, in person or on the telephone in a warm and friendly manner; and announcing them appropriately, answering or referring inquiries Directs visitors by maintaining employee and department directories; giving instructions Maintains security by following procedures and controlling access; monitoring logbook; issuing visitor badges Maintains telecommunication system by following manufacturer's instructions for house phone and console operation Maintains safe and clean reception area by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations. Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Manage reception meeting room bookings Supports the leadership team with any important client/ VIP visits to the building Performs other clerical receptionist duties such as filing, photocopying, collating, faxing etc. Liaise with all other departments, our Finance team in particular to raise, maintain and receipt purchase orders as required Perform additional duties such as Team Member directory upkeep Assist in the deployment, collection and management of TELUS Digital assets Ordering taxis for visitors, if requested by management Requirements: Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite Professional appearance Third-level education Must be available to support reception operational hours between 6am -9pm Monday ‚Äì Friday, on a full-time basis (40 hours per week) Previous experience in a customer-facing role essential Self-starting attitude and self-motivation Responsible and initiative Dynamic person It is advantageous for applicants to be a car owner and hold a full EU/UK Drivers‚Äô License Competencies: Solid communication skills both written and verbal Ability to be resourceful and proactive in dealing with issues that may arise Ability to organise, multitask, prioritise and work under pressure TELUS Digital recognizes and embraces the importance of values in our ever-changing workplace. To be successful, all candidates must demonstrate behaviors that are reflective of our values: We embrace change and initiate opportunity We have a passion for growth We believe in spirited teamwork We have the courage to innovate At TELUS Digital, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. Title: Executive Assistant - Corporate & Administrative Services
Description: Overview LabConnect improves lives by partnering with pharmaceutical and biotech companies, and clinical research organizations (CROs) to accelerate the development of new medicines around the world. We are an independent, global, one-stop-shop focused on delivering Central Laboratory Services that are tailor-made, timely and flexible to meet the evolving study demands of traditional to increasingly complex trials. Additionally, we provide Functional Service Provider (FSP) Solutions, supporting our clients with scientific and technical expertise, acting as an extension of their team, coordinating all laboratory related needs, advising on strategies for lab data collection and providing end-to-end analytical and logistical solutions. Summary LabConnect EMEA is seeking to hire an organized, motivated and detail-oriented multi-tasker to join our team. You will provide high-level administrative support to the Executive Team, create and manage the operational dashboard and is responsible for several projects within EMEA. You will be working on-site in one of our locations. Duties and Responsibilities Support Executive Director, Global Bio Operations Serve as key liaison between Executive Director, Global Bio Operations and key internal and external partners, clients, institutions, and other stakeholders, providing excellent customer service. Responsible for calendar management, including planning meetings, taking notes, and overseeing the execution of open actions. Coordinate recurring check-ins and communicate with multiple parties to schedule events. Provide high-level operational and administrative support. Complete expense reports, reimbursements, and travel arrangements. Assist in the management of organizational budgets, tracking metrics, and creating dashboards for EMEA operations using SharePoint and Power BI. Manage additional projects for the EMEA region and global initiatives. Organize all meeting logistics: booking meetings, locations, and caterers. Maintain and distribute related documents, e.g., manuals, minutes, rosters, etc. Record minutes during meetings and distribute to members post-meetings. Project Management and Metrics Tracking Lead EMEA and global project management efforts, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. Track key metrics and create dashboards in SharePoint to visualize data and support decision-making. Utilize Power BI to analyze data and generate insights for continuous improvement. Additional Information Education, Qualifications And Requirements Equivalent to graduation from a four-year college. Additional professional or administrative experience may be substituted for the education on a year-for-year basis. A minimum of two years of experience in a comparable role. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially within Excel and Power-BI. Proven track record of excellent follow-through and accountability. Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks and execute multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with creating dashboards and project management. Ability to work independently. Willing to travel and work on both location in Swalmen and Cologne. Self-starter with a positive, can-do attitude. Flexible and able to meet changing work needs and demands. Being proactive and anticipating future needs Strong writing, proofreading and verbal communication skills. Excellent time management skills. Language Ability Fluent in English and preferably in Dutch and/or German Read more below and get ready for your next great employment adventure! Some of the Perks our LabConnectors Love: We truly live our values: People First, Quality Focused, Customer Centered, Technology Driven and Accountability Always. The ability to make an impact on a passionate and growing team Great communication on a smaller sized team A market based salary Tools to effectively do your job (laptop, phone reimbursement) In addition to great perks and challenging work assignments, we invest in our people with enriching career growth opportunities. We believe in a friendly and collaborative environment with open lines of communication. Join our team and discover how your work can impact the lives of people all over the world. Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant to Founders ‚Äì Real Estate Firm | Berlin Hauser Recruiting is delighted to partner with a prestigious real estate firm with stunning offices in Berlin. We are seeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide first-class support to the Founders, who travel extensively across Europe and require seamless assistance. This is a dynamic role for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and is passionate about excellence in executive support. You must be able to work interchangeably in English & German. On offer is a hugely generous salary and bonus, hybrid working model, team events and much more! Duties will include: Full Diary & Complex Travel Management ‚Äì Take complete ownership of the Founders' schedules, ensuring seamless coordination, anticipating challenges, and providing solutions proactively. Event & Project Coordination ‚Äì Arranging local / international team & industry events. Strategic Administrative Support ‚Äì Managing correspondence, meeting action points, preparing reports, expenses, invoice payments. Client & Partner Liaison ‚Äì Serve as the primary point of contact, maintaining relationships and ensuring flawless communication. Light Personal Support - Handle some personal administration, on occasion. What You‚Äôll Need: Experience supporting busy Executives or High-Net-Worth-Individuals with complex scheduling and international travel. High aptitude for logistics management and ability to deal with last minute changes calmly, under pressure. Ability to work full-time (40-hour contract) with the flexibility to respond to urgent needs outside typical working hours, particularly when the Founders are at peak business times. A passion for executive support, bringing enthusiasm, precision, and a proactive approach to daily operations. Excellent business communication skills in both German & English. The ability to work autonomously while working seamlessly with other managers and employees in the office. This is an exceptional opportunity for a top-tier EA to join a prestigious firm and contribute to its continued success. The role is to start ASAP - don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Nederlandse Klantenservice Voor Igaming In Malta - Verhuispakket Inbegrepen
Description: Next Job Abroad biedt een geweldige kans voor een Nederlandse Klantenservice Agent in de snelgroeiende iGaming industrie in Malta! Title: Office Manager Frankfurt
Description: Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid. Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa. Job Description What is it all about? We are seeking an enthusiastic and highly organized Office Manager to join our team in Frankfurt! In this key role, you will support both our local team and the Regional Office Manager Central Europe in the smooth day-to-day running of our Frankfurt office. Your strong organizational and communication skills will be essential as you handle a variety of administrative tasks, manage onsite services, and ensure Health & Safety standards are met. As the first point of contact for colleagues, you will represent our company with professionalism, a friendly and positive attitude, and a well-presented manner. If you thrive in a dynamic office environment and enjoy supporting others, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! What we expect of you, day to day: Site Operations Manage onsite services (cleaning, catering, maintenance, office supplies) Space planning Site Security, Safety & Environment Health & Safety tasks (Visa + country-specific requirements) PO/invoice processes and local vendor relations VIP & Executive site visits Support onboarding and access for new joiners Oversee reception and visitor experience Stand-in receptionist Operations Monitor and maintain office supplies inventory Maintain a safe and secure working environment respecting all health & safety regulations (Visa rules and regulations, German labor law), implementing all required inspections, trainings and drills Effectively and successfully respond to problem situations Provide Reception support & management of legal documents Organise staff events Security and H&S: Guarantee a clean and safe office, liaising with contracted services and vendors, and ensuring that they comply with Visa standards (both Security and H&S) Be the point of contact for Security London and the Health & Safety Teams Respond to special incidents Dispose correctly of confidential waste Support the Crisis Management Team onsite Facilities: Manage relationships: vendors, service providers and landlord Manage Ask Corporate Services & Office Hub use and petitions Ensure application of OM Playbook Participate actively in any facilities renovations or expansions, as well as routine maintenance Maintain supply inventory Finance Prepare and fulfill OPEX budget Ensure correct utilization of purchase card (including expense reports), Purchase Orders & invoice support Provide strong support in audit processes Qualifications What we're after... Bachelor's Degree or diploma in business, management, finance or hospitality (nice to have) 5 or more years of admin and office management experience in very busy and international environment, covering regional activities, and regional offices experience in supporting large events, supporting facilities for other Offices/Hospitality/Executive Assistance Experience cooperating with the senior stakeholders. Great communication skills and working under the pressure English and German on Advanced level at least Additional Information Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law. Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you‚Äôll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You‚Äôll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us‚Äîwith the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager (Part Time) ‚Äì Workplace & Office Operations
Description: Your role As our Office Manager , your role goes beyond creating a pleasant atmosphere ‚Äì you're responsible for building and maintaining the foundation of a well-structured, safe, and smoothly functioning office workspace and infrastructure. With a solution-oriented and hands-on mindset, you take ownership of the spaces, routines, and resources that keep our daily office life running. Infuse positive energy into the work environment, putting smiles on the faces of employees, applicants, suppliers, and visitors You will take full ownership of our office infrastructure for more than 250 people ‚Äì this includes planning and organizing the office layout, coordinating furniture needs, and ensuring a functional, well-designed workspace You'll also manage security and access control, making sure everyone can work safely and efficiently Regular facility checks and ensuring safety compliance are also part of your weekly routine Coordinate and manage relationships with vendors and service providers to ensure a seamless day-to-day office operation Collaborate closely with our Office Management team of three to continuously improve our office workflows, support internal teams, and foster a culture of sustainability and operational excellence Your profile Ideally, you have professional experience in Administration, Office Management, Reception & Front Desk, Business Operations, or Operations Management You should have experience working in large office spaces and managing their operations ‚Äì know-how in office expansions or multi-site operations is a big plus! Ideally, you also bring knowledge in office safety & security management, office space and furniture planning, and facility maintenance, and understand their importance for operational efficiency and the overall employee experience You embody an open, helpful nature, combined with an independent working style and a strong desire to take ownership of your projects You have very good communication skills in both English and German, and you're available for 32 hours per week starting from November What we offer An appealing discount on all of our products ‚Äì from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation' We offer German and English language courses ‚Äì financed entirely by us! Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Contact Sabrina Thome Apply for this job About Us Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy ‚Äì as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations. We take our ecological responsibility very seriously : Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable. We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues. We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don‚Äôt match with 100% of the requirements. Title: Probationary Officer
Description: This Job Is Provided By Apna.co JOB DISCRIPTION Probationary Officer (MBA Required) - High Financial Branches (Muthoot) Position Title: Probationary Officer Location: High Financial Branches (Across Designated Locations) Salary: 2,67LPA Upto ‚Çπ3,10,000 per annum + Performance-based Variables & Incentives Growth Opportunity: Fast-Track Promotion to Assistant Manager About Muthoot: Muthoot Group is one of the most trusted and established names in the financial services sector, offering a wide range of products including gold loans, personal loans, insurance, and wealth management services. We are committed to delivering customer satisfaction, fostering innovation, and offering exceptional growth opportunities to our employees. Position Overview: We are seeking dynamic, results-driven individuals with an MBA (minimum 50%) to join our team as Probationary Officers in our high financial branches. This role is designed to give you exposure to branch management, customer relationship handling, and revenue generation, while offering the potential for fast-track career advancement, with promotion opportunities to Assistant Manager based on performance. Key Responsibilities Branch Operations Management: Oversee and ensure smooth operations at high-performing branches, maintaining compliance with internal policies and regulatory standards. Customer Relationship Management: Build and nurture relationships with existing and new customers, offering tailored financial solutions to meet their needs. Sales & Business Development: Canvassing and sourcing of New Customers to increase Gold loan Business,Drive business generation by actively promoting and selling Muthoot‚Äôs financial products and services. Meet and exceed sales targets. Financial Performance Monitoring: Revenue generations through Cross Selling products & Interest Collection Work towards enhancing branch financial performance, improving sales, and implementing strategies to achieve business goals. Team Coordination: Lead and work collaboratively with branch staff, ensuring optimal productivity, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction. Compliance & Risk Management: Ensure that all operations adhere to legal, regulatory, and company standards. Identify and manage operational risks effectively. Qualifications & Skills Educational Qualification: MBA (with at least 60% marks) MCOM (with at least 70% marks) Experience: Fresh MBA graduates or candidates with up to 2 years of relevant work experience in banking, finance, or related sectors. Skills: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Knowledge of banking operations, financial products, and services. Good analytical and problem solving abilities. Target-driven and results-oriented approach. Proficiency in MS Office and other financial tools/software. What We Offer: Salary: ‚Çπ 2,67,000 UPTO ‚Çπ3,10,000 per annum with additional performance-based variables and incentives. Career Growth: Fast-track promotion to Assistant Manager based on performance and branch success. Training & Development: Extensive training to develop your skills and knowledge for rapid career advancement. Work Environment: A vibrant and collaborative work culture that fosters learning and growth. Interested candidate can send their udated Resume TO Regional Hr KIRAN KUMAR 8074611369 or Mail recruitncni@muthootgroup.com or Walkin & walk out with offer letter on below Addres: Muthoot Finance Ltd.Regional office RV Tower, No:77 / 1 Habibullah Road, T-Nagar Chennai - 600017. Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: One of Hauser Recruiting's new clients - a European investment firm - has recently opened their new modern office in prime location in Frankfurt and they seek their first Executive Assistant / Office Manager. Fluency in German and advanced English language skills are essential! This is an established firm with offices throughout Europe, and a start-up feel in Frankfurt. Title: Executive Assistant
Description: A rare opportunity for an Assistant seeking a varied and dynamic role in Frankfurt's Bankenviertel! It can't be overstated that every day working for this boutique investment firm will be different... This will suit you if you enjoy working in an everchanging environment, adapting to shifting priorities and have the ability to think outside the box. You must have fluent German & advanced English language skills. You'll work alongside the Office Manager / Senior Executive Assistant who is an expert in her field, with more than 20 years supporting at the most senior level, and she is keen to share information, help you to upskill and support your career development. She has a wonderful balance of professionalism and fun - and she's looking for a great teammate! In return, you'll be rewarded with a highly competitive salary, target-driven bonuses, career development and a role that will allow you to add real value. You will enjoy this role if you like working in a smaller (yet very chic!) office environment. This will be office-based 5 days per week during Probezeit, with home office opportunity upon successful completion. The Role You will support the Managing Director, and work very closely with the Senior Executive Assistant / Office Manager to support with office and project management. Core duties include: Calendar coordination & inbox management Travel arrangements Organisation of meetings Preparation of presentations Handling sensitive legal, financial & personnel documentation Expenses, invoicing Arranging events Ad-hoc projects Ensuring the smooth running of the office alongside the Office Manager Covering for the Office Manager when she is away To be considered for this role, these are essential skills and attributes: Demonstrate experience in high-level service-oriented environments (such as completed your Hotelfachfrau/mann Ausbildung in 5* hotels), or worked as an Assistant in a similar boutique environment Demonstrate previous experience working with high-net-worth individuals / senior executives Possess fluent German and advanced English skills Comprehensive MS Office knowledge Excellent organisational and administrative skills Enjoy and work well in an ever-changing environment with moving deadlines Ability to problem-solve and use initiative Possess a professional and calm demeanour Impeccable attention to detail Exercise discretion and confidentiality If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Description: Since September 2023, Fotografiska Berlin has become a cultural destination, set within a restored historic landmark. Whether welcoming guests, running food and drinks, refreshing table settings, or anticipating needs before they arise, you set a tone of understated luxury and authentic hospitality. You will collaborate closely with the host, server, bar, and management teams to deliver exceptional service at every point of contact. Key Responsibilities Provide a warm, polished welcome and gracious farewell to all members and guests Assist with greeting, guiding, and seating guests in collaboration with the Host team Run food and beverages from kitchen and bar with elegance, accuracy, and care Support servers by anticipating guest needs, refilling water, clearing dishes, and resetting tables with speed and attention to detail Maintain the flow of the floor by staying attuned to table turnover, pacing, and service rhythm Ensure all menus, table settings, and guest-facing materials are impeccably maintained Communicate guest needs and special requests to the appropriate team members in real time Keep all FOH areas tidy and service-ready, performing side duties and checklists as needed Participate in team briefings, service reviews, and ongoing training sessions Serve as a knowledgeable and enthusiastic representative of Ver≈çnika and Fotografiska, engaging guests in our story and offerings when appropriate Requirements 1-2 years of experience in a hospitality, runner, or service assistant role; fine dining or cultural destination experience preferred Poise, professionalism, and a genuine desire to deliver heartfelt service Comfort working within a dynamic, high-volume, guest-focused environment Menu knowledge and ability to present dishes in English and German Minimum a few basic phrases in German to great and welcome our guests Confidence navigating guest interactions in English; German and additional languages are a plus Proficiency with reservation platforms such as 7Rooms or TheFork is a plus Physical stamina to stand and move throughout long shift Willingness to work flexible hours including evenings, weekends, and holidays A collaborative spirit and commitment to supporting colleagues across roles Diversity & Representation: Fotografiska is committed to building and supporting diverse and representative communities, long-term career opportunities and extends Equal Employment Opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law. Benefits All of our employees benefit from great and well developed benefits: Company Pension Plan Company Health Insurance Annual health budget for 13 high-quality services Mobility subsidy Food subsidy Free Admission to our Museum for you and a limited number of Family & Friends Discount in Retail Paid Time Off Training & Development As Fotografiska Berlin develops, the existing benefits roster is set to expand - more to come!
