Title: Executive Assistant - Corporate & Administrative Services
Description: Overview LabConnect improves lives by partnering with pharmaceutical and biotech companies, and clinical research organizations (CROs) to accelerate the development of new medicines around the world. We are an independent, global, one-stop-shop focused on delivering Central Laboratory Services that are tailor-made, timely and flexible to meet the evolving study demands of traditional to increasingly complex trials. Additionally, we provide Functional Service Provider (FSP) Solutions, supporting our clients with scientific and technical expertise, acting as an extension of their team, coordinating all laboratory related needs, advising on strategies for lab data collection and providing end-to-end analytical and logistical solutions. Summary LabConnect EMEA is seeking to hire an organized, motivated and detail-oriented multi-tasker to join our team. You will provide high-level administrative support to the Executive Team, create and manage the operational dashboard and is responsible for several projects within EMEA. You will be working on-site in one of our locations. Duties and Responsibilities Support Executive Director, Global Bio Operations Serve as key liaison between Executive Director, Global Bio Operations and key internal and external partners, clients, institutions, and other stakeholders, providing excellent customer service. Responsible for calendar management, including planning meetings, taking notes, and overseeing the execution of open actions. Coordinate recurring check-ins and communicate with multiple parties to schedule events. Provide high-level operational and administrative support. Complete expense reports, reimbursements, and travel arrangements. Assist in the management of organizational budgets, tracking metrics, and creating dashboards for EMEA operations using SharePoint and Power BI. Manage additional projects for the EMEA region and global initiatives. Organize all meeting logistics: booking meetings, locations, and caterers. Maintain and distribute related documents, e.g., manuals, minutes, rosters, etc. Record minutes during meetings and distribute to members post-meetings. Project Management and Metrics Tracking Lead EMEA and global project management efforts, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. Track key metrics and create dashboards in SharePoint to visualize data and support decision-making. Utilize Power BI to analyze data and generate insights for continuous improvement. Additional Information Education, Qualifications And Requirements Equivalent to graduation from a four-year college. Additional professional or administrative experience may be substituted for the education on a year-for-year basis. A minimum of two years of experience in a comparable role. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially within Excel and Power-BI. Proven track record of excellent follow-through and accountability. Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks and execute multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with creating dashboards and project management. Ability to work independently. Willing to travel and work on both location in Swalmen and Cologne. Self-starter with a positive, can-do attitude. Flexible and able to meet changing work needs and demands. Being proactive and anticipating future needs Strong writing, proofreading and verbal communication skills. Excellent time management skills. Language Ability Fluent in English and preferably in Dutch and/or German Read more below and get ready for your next great employment adventure! Some of the Perks our LabConnectors Love: We truly live our values: People First, Quality Focused, Customer Centered, Technology Driven and Accountability Always. The ability to make an impact on a passionate and growing team Great communication on a smaller sized team A market based salary Tools to effectively do your job (laptop, phone reimbursement) In addition to great perks and challenging work assignments, we invest in our people with enriching career growth opportunities. We believe in a friendly and collaborative environment with open lines of communication. Join our team and discover how your work can impact the lives of people all over the world. It is the policy of LabConnect to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law. Equal Employment Opportunity Posters: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters If you have a disability and you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please email talent@labconnect.com or call +1(423)722-3155. For more information, visit www.labconnect.com Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant (m/f/d) Private Equity Firm Munich A global private equity firm in central Munich with a strong team of Assistants is seeking 2 new Executive Assistants / Team Assistants to support investment professionals in a busy firm. These are full secretarial & administrative roles, requiring a strong team player who enjoys working at a fast pace. You must have worked in an international firm or in 5-star hospitality in a support role, for example on reception, administration or events, and speak German & English to a fluent level - this is essential for this role! This firm offers incredible benefits to their employees, in terms of remuneration, well-being, opportunity to travel and work in their European offices, and career progression. They will support you by helping with relocation costs if you are moving to Munich. THE FIRM My client is a global investment firm with offices based in the heart of Munich and all across Europe, Asia and North America. They pride themselves on their values: being respectful, friendly, entrepreneurial, and they operate across a very flat structure. They only invest into firms that will do good, and firms with values aligned to their own, and they are very charitable and care about sustainability (and can prove it!) making this a very special place to work. This is a hugely supportive and collaborative environment, with encouragement to learn more and develop your skill set. THE ROLE You will support 3-5 investment professionals of varying seniority, and you're encouraged to take on wider projects if you would like to. The main duties are: Managing multiple diaries and arranging meetings across time zones Coordinating and booking international travel with often complex itineraries and last minute changes Processing expenses Replying to emails in German and English on behalf of the team Document management (signatures, printing, binding) Occasional event organisation for the local teams Anything ad-hoc that's needed to ensure the job gets done THE CANDIDATE This is an environment that values team work and you must enjoy working in a team. They look for very humble, intelligent, professional and friendly candidates who enjoy a fast paced environment and who want to learn, not afraid to ask questions. To be successful in this role, you must: Be service-oriented, with some experience in a similar administrative or organisational role, or have worked in hospitality / events Possess fluent German and English language skills Be able to build professional relationships Have the ability to prioritise and handle multiple requests Be resilient and calm when there are last-minute changes Be a team player Have a high level of accuracy and attention to detail Have good knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Value the role of an Assistant THE PACKAGE On top of a competitive base salary (in line with experience) there are the following benefits: Hugely generous performance-related bonus Annual salary review Company pay into a private pension Wellness benefits including gym membership Travel to work paid for Mobile phone for business and personal use Home office budget Annual Christmas & Summer parties in Munich & London Annual ski conference Free food and drinks all day, lunch cooked for you onsite 30 days' holiday, plus public holidays Relocation support if you are moving to Munich! If this is for you, please apply today! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Join our dynamic team in Munich as an Executive Assistant. MERMEC Deutschland is a dynamic and growing company in the rail sector. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and enjoy a variety of responsibilities, in a business unit in growth. We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to provide direct support to our executive management team, particularly the CEO. This role involves a mix of administrative, organizational, and communication responsibilities, requiring strong multitasking skills and discretion. Responsibilities: Provide high-level administrative support to the CEO and executive team Manage calendars, coordinate appointments, and schedule meetings Organize and book business travel (individual and group) Prepare meeting materials, presentations, and internal reports Follow up on meeting action points and deadlines Plan and support internal and external events Handle incoming calls and emails on behalf of the executives Liaise with internal departments and external partners as needed Qualifications: Completed commercial training or similar qualification Experience in executive assistance is an advantage Strong organizational and time-management skills Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities High discretion and sense of responsibility Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Fluent in German and English (written and spoken) Ability to work independently, flexibly, and reliably We are looking forward for you application! Show more Show less

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and enjoy a variety of responsibilities, in a business unit in growth. We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to provide direct support to our executive management team, particularly the CEO. This role involves a mix of administrative, organizational, and communication responsibilities, requiring strong multitasking skills and discretion. Responsibilities: Provide high-level administrative support to the CEO and executive team Manage calendars, coordinate appointments, and schedule meetings Organize and book business travel (individual and group) Prepare meeting materials, presentations, and internal reports Follow up on meeting action points and deadlines Plan and support internal and external events Handle incoming calls and emails on behalf of the executives Liaise with internal departments and external partners as needed Qualifications: Completed commercial training or similar qualification Experience in executive assistance is an advantage Strong organizational and time-management skills Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities High discretion and sense of responsibility Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Fluent in German and English (written and spoken) Ability to work independently, flexibly, and reliably We are looking forward for you application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: One of Hauser Recruiting's new clients - a European investment firm - has recently opened their new modern office in prime location in Frankfurt and they seek their first Executive Assistant / Office Manager. Fluency in German and advanced English language skills are essential! This is an established firm with offices throughout Europe, and a start-up feel in Frankfurt. This will suit you if you are an Executive Assistant or Team Assistant, able & happy to work as the team's sole support, with a view to establishing structure. You will work closely with other European business support colleagues, manage the Frankfurt office, and set the standards for future members of the business support team. You should enjoy working in an environment that changes constantly, and no two days will be the same! You should be happy supporting the whole team. My client has plans to double the number of employees in the next year - an exciting time to join in this period of company growth! Because you are responsible for the office as well as providing EA support, this role is office-based 5 days per week. This could be more flexible when the business support team grows. If this is an opportunity that suits your career motivators, what skills should you bring to be considered for the role? Proven history in a European or global financial services / investment business Experience as a Team Assistant or Executive Assistant with diverse duties including diary management, travel organisation, expenses, administration & some office management tasks Advanced, confident communication skills in English & fluency in German - essential Well-structured and independent working style Proactive support, taking on small and large tasks without differentiation Ability to multi-task Ideally some experience of organising team events If this sounds like you, and you are seeking a new challenge, please don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant to Founders ‚Äì Real Estate Firm | Berlin Hauser Recruiting is delighted to partner with a prestigious real estate firm with stunning offices in Berlin. We are seeking a highly skilled Executive Assistant to provide first-class support to the Founders, who travel extensively across Europe and require seamless assistance. This is a dynamic role for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and is passionate about excellence in executive support. You must be able to work interchangeably in English & German. On offer is a hugely generous salary and bonus, hybrid working model, team events and much more! Duties will include: Full Diary & Complex Travel Management ‚Äì Take complete ownership of the Founders' schedules, ensuring seamless coordination, anticipating challenges, and providing solutions proactively. Event & Project Coordination ‚Äì Arranging local / international team & industry events. Strategic Administrative Support ‚Äì Managing correspondence, meeting action points, preparing reports, expenses, invoice payments. Client & Partner Liaison ‚Äì Serve as the primary point of contact, maintaining relationships and ensuring flawless communication. Light Personal Support - Handle some personal administration, on occasion. What You‚Äôll Need: Experience supporting busy Executives or High-Net-Worth-Individuals with complex scheduling and international travel. High aptitude for logistics management and ability to deal with last minute changes calmly, under pressure. Ability to work full-time (40-hour contract) with the flexibility to respond to urgent needs outside typical working hours, particularly when the Founders are at peak business times. A passion for executive support, bringing enthusiasm, precision, and a proactive approach to daily operations. Excellent business communication skills in both German & English. The ability to work autonomously while working seamlessly with other managers and employees in the office. This is an exceptional opportunity for a top-tier EA to join a prestigious firm and contribute to its continued success. The role is to start ASAP - don't delay your application! Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant - Corporate & Administrative Services
Description: Overview LabConnect improves lives by partnering with pharmaceutical and biotech companies, and clinical research organizations (CROs) to accelerate the development of new medicines around the world. We are an independent, global, one-stop-shop focused on delivering Central Laboratory Services that are tailor-made, timely and flexible to meet the evolving study demands of traditional to increasingly complex trials. Additionally, we provide Functional Service Provider (FSP) Solutions, supporting our clients with scientific and technical expertise, acting as an extension of their team, coordinating all laboratory related needs, advising on strategies for lab data collection and providing end-to-end analytical and logistical solutions. Summary LabConnect EMEA is seeking to hire an organized, motivated and detail-oriented multi-tasker to join our team. You will provide high-level administrative support to the Executive Team, create and manage the operational dashboard and is responsible for several projects within EMEA. You will be working on-site in one of our locations. Duties and Responsibilities Support Executive Director, Global Bio Operations Serve as key liaison between Executive Director, Global Bio Operations and key internal and external partners, clients, institutions, and other stakeholders, providing excellent customer service. Responsible for calendar management, including planning meetings, taking notes, and overseeing the execution of open actions. Coordinate recurring check-ins and communicate with multiple parties to schedule events. Provide high-level operational and administrative support. Complete expense reports, reimbursements, and travel arrangements. Assist in the management of organizational budgets, tracking metrics, and creating dashboards for EMEA operations using SharePoint and Power BI. Manage additional projects for the EMEA region and global initiatives. Organize all meeting logistics: booking meetings, locations, and caterers. Maintain and distribute related documents, e.g., manuals, minutes, rosters, etc. Record minutes during meetings and distribute to members post-meetings. Project Management and Metrics Tracking Lead EMEA and global project management efforts, ensuring alignment with organizational goals. Track key metrics and create dashboards in SharePoint to visualize data and support decision-making. Utilize Power BI to analyze data and generate insights for continuous improvement. Additional Information Education, Qualifications And Requirements Equivalent to graduation from a four-year college. Additional professional or administrative experience may be substituted for the education on a year-for-year basis. A minimum of two years of experience in a comparable role. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially within Excel and Power-BI. Proven track record of excellent follow-through and accountability. Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks and execute multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with creating dashboards and project management. Ability to work independently. Willing to travel and work on both location in Swalmen and Cologne. Self-starter with a positive, can-do attitude. Flexible and able to meet changing work needs and demands. Being proactive and anticipating future needs Strong writing, proofreading and verbal communication skills. Excellent time management skills. Language Ability Fluent in English and preferably in Dutch and/or German Read more below and get ready for your next great employment adventure! Some of the Perks our LabConnectors Love: We truly live our values: People First, Quality Focused, Customer Centered, Technology Driven and Accountability Always. The ability to make an impact on a passionate and growing team Great communication on a smaller sized team A market based salary Tools to effectively do your job (laptop, phone reimbursement) In addition to great perks and challenging work assignments, we invest in our people with enriching career growth opportunities. We believe in a friendly and collaborative environment with open lines of communication. Join our team and discover how your work can impact the lives of people all over the world. It is the policy of LabConnect to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law. Equal Employment Opportunity Posters: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters If you have a disability and you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please email talent@labconnect.com or call +1(423)722-3155. Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Responsibilities: The Executive Assistant (EA) provides project and business administration support to the search team in all aspects of the search process including: document preparation and management, scheduling and planning of candidate and client interviews and meetings, accounts receivable and accounts payable, expense reporting, correspondence and file management. An integral part of an EA‚Äôs role is problem solving within the search execution and administrative process. Specific Responsibilities: Responsible for the administration of the search process for all team search assignments Formatting, editing, proofreading, preparing and transmitting client deliverables Maintaining consultant calendar Preparing travel itineraries for the consultant, client or candidate in any part of the search process Supporting search team with account management and client relationship, including consultant expenses, client invoices/receivables and other financial reports Creating and maintaining an efficient file management and follow-up system for all search processes Maintaining client and candidate communications through scheduling and prioritizing telephone and email communication Verifying degrees of candidates Consistently building strong relationships and good rapport with candidates and clients Maintaining the accuracy, quality and integrity of all search information in the Heidrick & Struggles database Maintaining and developing job-related skills by attending Company learning programs and keeping up-to-date with job/industry-related reading Maintaining client, candidate and companywide confidentiality Contributing to the team and office by providing reception relief and back-up assistance to other EAs May assist with database research and coding of records in collaboration with Associate or Research Associate practice resources Qualifications: High school education required; college degree desired At least five years of administrative experience in roles requiring strong project coordination Demonstrate a business acumen and financial awareness Proficient knowledge of all Microsoft Office products. Minimum keyboarding skills of 60wpm. Experience with proprietary database environments, a plus Excellent communication skills‚Äîverbal, written and listening Experience dealing with people at all levels of an organization, getting and giving often complex and sensitive information in both verbal and written communications Professional services experience, a plus Fluency in both German and English Behavioral Competencies: External and internal awareness: Maintains personal contacts across the internal organization and appropriately shares information. Addresses business process issues proactively with other areas, as necessary Analytical Thinking: Develops frameworks to assure that ‚Äúpros‚Äù and ‚Äúcons‚Äù are evaluated, key issues are identified and detailed analysis is synthesized Creative Thinking: Sets a personal example of seeking out new and better ways of doing things Stays open to new ideas and approaches Generates new ideas Client orientation: Constantly hones understanding and responsiveness to internal and external client requirements, goals and issues Self-confidence and determination Manages most situations in a calm, steady, ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù manner Demonstrates self-confidence; resilient Demonstrates a focus on results over time; resourceful, tenacious Relationship building Takes the time to maintain relationships and create new ones Driving results: Manages projects, activities and resources according to search and team strategy effectively Sets priorities and reviews progress against goals regularly Multitasks effectively and efficiently Best practice perspective: Seeks to adopt best practices to increase effectiveness and organization competitiveness Eager to participate in the coaching and mentoring of new employees through formal and informal learning programs and relationships Possesses strong personal commitment to quality standards and meeting quality expectations Gives constructive feedback and recommends suggestions for improvement, where appropriate Organizational buy-in: Generates enthusiasm for Company strategies and key initiatives Energizes others with whom he/she is in regular contact Personal Characteristics Available to work Monday through Friday during normal office hours Demonstrates strong business ethics (honesty, integrity, confidentiality, discretion) in all situations Strong team player Maintains composure in fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Displays appropriate sense of humor in the workplace Flexible to work overtime, when needed Show more Show less

Title: Office Services Assistant
Description: Who You'll Work With You are someone who thrives in a high-performance environment, bringing a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle meaningful challenges that have a real impact. In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we‚Äôll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities to help you quickly broaden your expertise, grow into a well-rounded professional, and contribute to work that truly makes a difference. When you join us, you will have: Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey. A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes. Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Exceptional benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family. Your Impact McKinsey is a global business consultancy that helps organizations achieve sustainable, inclusive growth. We work with clients in the private, public, and social sectors to solve complex problems and create positive change for all involved. We combine bold strategies and transformative technologies to help companies innovate more sustainably, achieve lasting performance improvements, and build workforces that will thrive for this generation and the next. In Germany and Austria, McKinsey has offices in Berlin, D√ºsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Cologne, Munich, Stuttgart, and Vienna. Globally, McKinsey teams work in more than 130 cities and 65 countries. At McKinsey, people with diverse career backgrounds work together. In Office Management, they include former translators, flight attendants, and hotel managers. As part of our three-person reception team, you will be the first point of contact in our Berlin office. You will quickly and flexibly help with all organizational tasks and ensure the seamless processing of our services. Among other responsibilities, you will manage room reservations for meetings, ensure optimal room planning, and make sure that every event room is equipped with the required technology. You will competently support colleagues and visitors from Germany and abroad before and after meetings ‚Äì and provide reliable information at all times. At our switchboard, you will take phone calls and forward them to the correct contact person. In Facility Management, you will assist with various office projects, such as coordinating appointments with suppliers, supporting them during visits, creating key figure analyses, and preparing presentations and meeting minutes. You will also be responsible for administration and organization in the mailroom, including processing incoming and outgoing mail and providing office supplies and IT equipment. In addition, you will take on administrative tasks and process invoices for external services. From the outset, you will take on responsibility for your own special tasks. Together with the team, you will further enhance the high-quality standards of our office. With us, you will find challenging tasks in an exceptionally committed team, with many opportunities for further training and great scope for personal development. In addition to modern offices in exclusive locations and state-of-the-art equipment, we offer other interesting benefits (e.g., free meals) and company-supported health management (e.g., sports offerings). Performance-based compensation and attractive social benefits round out our offer. The position is initially for a fixed term of two years. Your Qualifications and Skills You have completed your commercial professional training, e.g., as a hotel manager, ideally from a reputable hotel business. You have initial experience of reception work, in the hotel industry or in other service industry areas. You demonstrate strong service orientation and an aptitude for dealing with people. You think and act in a structured and conscientious manner and possess excellent communication and teamwork skills. You have excellent organizational skills and can set appropriate priorities. You are reliable and flexible, quick to grasp new concepts, and have good judgment. With your positive demeanor, you remain calm and maintain oversight even in hectic situations. You are fluent in German, have excellent written and spoken English skills, and are experienced at using standard Microsoft Office applications. Ideally, you have a technical understanding and aptitude, enabling you to quickly familiarize yourself with new technologies. Show more Show less

Title: Business Assistant
Description: Job Description This role is a great opportunity to demonstrate strong background as an Executive Assistant, with experience working with senior stakeholders in an office environment. This role requires a high degree of flexibility, confidentiality, and a strong work ethic. If your strong skills are excellent time management, resourcefulness, diligence, and a focus on business and client deliverables, then apply for this position! As a Senior Executive Assistant within our EMEA Currencies & Emerging Markets division, you will support senior stakeholders, demonstrating solid background as an Senior Executive Assistant, flexibility, confidentiality, and a strong work ethic. This role demands excellent time management, resourcefulness, diligence, and a focus on business and client deliverables. Job Responsibilities Manage advanced diary tasks by proactively handling internal and external meetings, conference calls, and organizing events such as Off-Sites, Town Halls, and Skip-Levels. Coordinate travel and entertainment by partnering with relevant groups to book arrangements, ensuring compliance with CIB/Firmwide policies. Handle client interactions by managing internal and external communications, coordinating department schedules and transactional activities. Process expenses by collaborating with teams to manage costs, enforcing policies, and ensuring timely handover of required information. Collaborate cross-functionally with business management and key stakeholders across lines of business (LoB). Utilize internal systems for accurate data entry, reporting, and information collation. Oversee administrative tasks such as managing distribution lists and technology usage. Integrate into the business by understanding group priorities and expectations. Partner with assistants across LoB to provide coverage as needed. Participate in PowerPoint presentations, projects, and training based on performance. Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills Demonstrate language proficiency by being fluent in German and English. Build and maintain business relationships through professional client handling. Apply good judgment in diary management and understand competing priorities, manage time efficiently through effective scheduling. Communicate effectively with strong written and verbal skills. Arrange travel by creating itineraries and optimizing time and costs. Exhibit high-level technical skills, understand expense systems and cost control initiatives. Maintain a polished, calm, and composed manner, able to work under pressure. Adapt to change with flexibility, act as a team player, being solution-oriented with the potential to serve as a role model. Deliver high-quality results with attention to detail; show proactivity and ownership by demonstrating initiative and responsibility within the role. Grasp the investment bank culture and political landscape quickly. Stay current with CIB/Firmwide policies and ensure compliance. ABOUT US J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world‚Äôs most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants‚Äô and employees‚Äô religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation. About The Team J.P. Morgan‚Äôs Commercial & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets, securities services and payments. Corporations, governments and institutions throughout the world entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. The Commercial & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world. Show more Show less

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and enjoy a variety of responsibilities, in a business unit in growth. We are seeking a detail-oriented and dependable Back Office Administrator to ensure the smooth running of daily office operations. The ideal candidate will be well-organized, collaborative, and capable of supporting multiple teams, including HR, in a fast-paced, international environment. Responsibilities: Manage document processing, data entry, and digital filing systems Maintain and update databases and internal records Support internal communication and coordination between departments Handle inquiries and correspondence internally and externally Oversee office supplies and infrastructure, ensuring everything runs smoothly Assist in preparing reports and administrative documents Organize internal events and provide support for employee onboarding Coordinate with departments such as HR for operational support Support a multicultural environment (experience with Italian and French is a plus) Qualifications: Completed commercial training or similar qualification Experience in a back office or administrative role is preferred Strong organizational skills with attention to detail Team player with good communication skills Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Fluent in German and English (written and spoken) Ability to manage multiple tasks and adapt quickly to new challenges We are looking forward for your application! Title: Team Assistant
Description: About The Opportunity Job Type: Permanent Application Deadline: 18 July 2025 Title Team Assistant Department Distribution Germany Location Kronberg im Taunus Reports To Head of Distribution Central Region and ETF and Index Distribution, Europe Level Grade 4 We‚Äôre proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. Scheduling and booking travel and meeting itineraries. You will take care to provide detailed instructions, covering every detail of the arrangements, including providing contingency contact numbers in case of unexpected changes or delays to plans. You will need to liaise effectively and professionally with all contacts, both internally and externally. This may involve disseminating or collating information, or co-ordinating events and meetings. Given the international context, effective liaison between different offices across the geographical boundaries is essential. We‚Äôll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we‚Äôll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work ‚Äì finding a balance that works for all of us. It‚Äôs all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. Title: Executive Assistant
Description: Executive Assistant (m/f/d) Private Equity Firm Munich A global private equity firm in central Munich with a strong team of Assistants is seeking 2 new Executive Assistants / Team Assistants to support investment professionals in a busy firm. These are full secretarial & administrative roles, requiring a strong team player who enjoys working at a fast pace. You must have worked in an international firm or in 5-star hospitality in a support role, for example on reception, administration or events, and speak German & English to a fluent level - this is essential for this role! This firm offers incredible benefits to their employees, in terms of remuneration, well-being, opportunity to travel and work in their European offices, and career progression. They will support you by helping with relocation costs if you are moving to Munich. THE FIRM My client is a global investment firm with offices based in the heart of Munich and all across Europe, Asia and North America. They pride themselves on their values: being respectful, friendly, entrepreneurial, and they operate across a very flat structure. They only invest into firms that will do good, and firms with values aligned to their own, and they are very charitable and care about sustainability (and can prove it!) making this a very special place to work. This is a hugely supportive and collaborative environment, with encouragement to learn more and develop your skill set. THE ROLE You will support 3-5 investment professionals of varying seniority, and you're encouraged to take on wider projects if you would like to. The main duties are: Managing multiple diaries and arranging meetings across time zones Coordinating and booking international travel with often complex itineraries and last minute changes Processing expenses Replying to emails in German and English on behalf of the team Document management (signatures, printing, binding) Occasional event organisation for the local teams Anything ad-hoc that's needed to ensure the job gets done THE CANDIDATE This is an environment that values team work and you must enjoy working in a team. They look for very humble, intelligent, professional and friendly candidates who enjoy a fast paced environment and who want to learn, not afraid to ask questions. To be successful in this role, you must: Be service-oriented, with some experience in a similar administrative or organisational role, or have worked in hospitality / events Possess fluent German and English language skills Be able to build professional relationships Have the ability to prioritise and handle multiple requests Be resilient and calm when there are last-minute changes Be a team player Have a high level of accuracy and attention to detail Have good knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Value the role of an Assistant THE PACKAGE On top of a competitive base salary (in line with experience) there are the following benefits: Hugely generous performance-related bonus Annual salary review Company pay into a private pension Wellness benefits including gym membership Travel to work paid for Mobile phone for business and personal use Home office budget Annual Christmas & Summer parties in Munich & London Annual ski conference Free food and drinks all day, lunch cooked for you onsite 30 days' holiday, plus public holidays Relocation support if you are moving to Munich! If this is for you, please apply today! Show more Show less

Title: Administrative Assistant For Office In Munich
Description: At F5, we strive to bring a better digital world to life. Our teams empower organizations across the globe to create, secure, and run applications that enhance how we experience our evolving digital world. We are passionate about cybersecurity, from protecting consumers from fraud to enabling companies to focus on innovation. Everything we do centers around people. That means we obsess over how to make the lives of our customers, and their customers, better. And it means we prioritize a diverse F5 community where each individual can thrive. We value our employees and act in a team-oriented and innovative manner. We emphasize diversity and think globally. Reliability, trustworthiness, and openness are important to us, as well as a high level of integrity. Overview: This position is an all-rounder role that is entrusted with independent tasks handling and projects within its competencies. You will take responsibility for a wide and interesting range of tasks in an international company and you will support the Regional Sales Vice President with administrative and organizational tasks as well as manage our Munich office. Your Tasks: Manage the reception, including the central telephone for the Munich office Support our Regional Sales Vice President with administrative and operational tasks (travel expense management, travel management, meeting minutes, independent coordination and arrangement of visits from international guests, organization of company events, appointment coordination) Manage the marketing storage and ensure timely shipping of marketing items to event locations, order management for marketing items in alignment with the marketing team Handle office management tasks: email management, document maintenance (contracts, orders, telephone lists, etc.), ordering and managing office supplies Be the first point of contact for our guests Planning and execution of organizational tasks for events, seminars, conferences and meetings Create cost statements Facility management and coordination of facility tasks with external service providers Take responsibility for all health and safety issues (first aid, fire protection) in the office, as well as reporting accidents Prepare meeting and office rooms and ensure a representative appearance, manage room bookings Collaborate and align with various departments such as sales, marketing, finance, and IT Your Profile: You have excellent and verifiable skills in planning, organization, and administration You work very independently, proactively, and reliably Excellent written and verbal communication skills Very good German and English language skills Advanced knowledge of Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Internet High service orientation & flexibility Team orientation Experience with safety regulations (first aid, fire protection) is an advantage Very good skills in prioritizing many different tasks Proactivity, solution orientation, and very good skills in dealing with various parties (employees, managers, guests, service providers) Existing first aid training or willingness to undergo training The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change. Title: Community Associate
Description: About Us At WeWork, we provide flexible workspace solutions to help businesses of all sizes thrive in more than 37 countries worldwide. The future of work is here, and we‚Äôre not just a part of that movement‚Äîwe‚Äôre leading it. United by a desire to build a global community, our purpose is to give members the support to do their best work, and the space to take their ideas to new heights. Join us as we empower tomorrow‚Äôs world at work. About The Opportunity As a Community Associate, you'll be the primary point of contact for the Community and act as the ‚Äúface‚Äù of WeWork! You will report to your building each day to support the Community Management team. Your work, which will include but not be limited to the duties listed below, will help WeWork to achieve the following: Build a welcoming and collaborative community environment amongst our members through events and building relationships between members! Ensure that your building is fully operational and processes are running efficiently. Drive growth and promotion of WeWork-provided service offerings. Take direction from the Community Lead and the Community Manager to support the Community Team as necessary. All of this while illustrating WeWork‚Äôs core values and working towards achieving our mission. In This Role, You‚Äôll Front Desk Management: Cover the front desk during the building‚Äôs set business hours and be an on-site point of contact, easily located on the member floor or at Community Bar. Greet members and guests with a warm and welcoming demeanor. Ensure all visiting guests are in accordance with WeWork's guest policy by ensuring all guests properly sign-in via Welkio iPad. Learn the names of members and guests with the goal of building relationships in order to facilitate the sense of community that WeWork is known for. Anticipate member and guest needs before they arise using relevant information collected about members to enhance and personalize their experience. Ensure building specific forms are up to date including pet forms, filming requests, bike room requests, etc. Keep the front desk clean and organized. Notify members of any food deliveries and couriers. Answer any questions from members and guests related to the building including way-finding, policies and procedures, community etiquette, etc. Events And Membership Engagement Provide feedback on programming types (based on member makeup) and evaluate events based on attendance, satisfaction, and impact on the appropriate event team. Consistently celebrate members‚Äô successes and milestones through gifts and notes. Distribute all necessary info to promote the event including creation and posting of weekly events poster and individual event posters. Ensure building-specific operational requirements are met for each event (elevators, HVAC, etc). Input notes into Kube or an equivalent system about members. Identify and execute opportunities to connect members with each other. Know and recommend local restaurants, food delivery services, catering options, team outing venues, post office, shipping center, supply store, etc. Be active on the WeWork member network to engage members. Know and explain WeWork policies and procedures and communicate, inform, and update members on building issues. Ensure music levels and activations are appropriate to the daypart and occasion. Write and send broadcasts relating to building updates. Building Operations And Management Receive, process, sort, and organize all mail. Locate and issue posts via the regional system to members upon request. Keep the mailroom organized and clean. ‚ÄúReturn to Sender" for unidentified mail and former member mail after 30 days of no-pick up. Ensure courier parcels have all the correct details for scheduled pick-ups. Investigate, escalate, and resolve 'lost' packages. Know and explain WeWork policies and procedures around mail and mailroom. Track, audit, and organize keys collected and distributed. Manage keycard stock and request new inventory as needed. Collect keys and key cards upon move-out. Review location and how to use each piece of emergency equipment. Provide support for an automated coffee machine for guests and members. About You We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you meet the qualifications below: College graduate with a four-year degree preferred, but not required. Customer service and/or sales experience a plus. Must have strong verbal and written communication skills. Outstanding interpersonal and multitasking skills. Demonstrate integrity, dependability, responsibility, accountability, self-awareness, work ethic, and compassion. Passion for entrepreneurial communities. Passion and understanding of WeWork‚Äôs mission and values. Proficient in basic computer skills. Life at WeWork Being a WeWorker is more than just a job. We believe the magic of work is sparked by the passion you bring, the places you go, the people you meet and the purpose you follow. And it starts here. Here you will brush shoulders with those who dare to dream and do. Here you will be welcomed by a community that embraces and inspires you‚Äîbecause together we can achieve more. Here we challenge ideas, and explore new ways of getting things done. Whether you are part of our Employee Community Groups, or part of a global project, we ask you to bring your open-minded attitude and collaborative spirit. In return, you will be part of a team where your unique perspectives are celebrated. Show more Show less

Title: Junior Office Manager
Description: Our Offer Takeover of own, varied projects and responsibilities from the beginning Prospects of being actively promoted and developed into an expert Team‚ÄØspirit and start-up atmosphere while working in a well-run organization Your work-life balance is important to us which is why flexible working hours and home office options are the norm for us and no exception Working at eye level with an experienced and interdisciplinary team Our onboarding program will help you get your bearings in the early days, and you will also have a personal buddy by your side Your Tasks Scheduling appointments (internal, client meetings, applicant interviews) Receipt and processing of incoming and outgoing mail Travel management including organizing and booking business trips Order management and preliminary accounting Professional customer reception and preparation of business meetings Planning and organizing internal and external events Supporting employees in all personnel matters Your Profile Commercial training or equivalent At least 1 year of professional experience in the secretarial/administrative field Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficient in common office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Confident and positive demeanor towards employees and customers Proficiency in German and very good English skills What will happen after you apply? Title: Executive Coordinator
Description: Location: Frankfurt, Germany Status: 18-Month Fixed Term Contract Reports to: Manager - Executive Coordinators Job Purpose: To provide support and executive assistance to the ISSB Senior Leadership team and the wider IFRS Foundation leadership teams as needed. Team: A team of executive coordinators work together to provide administrative support across the organisation. Each coordinator has specific responsibilities, which may change periodically, and coordinators will cover for each other during leave periods. The successful candidate should have a flexible attitude, be able to assume various tasks, and enjoy assisting others. The role requires flexibility, and attendance at the Frankfurt office is expected at least three days a week. Principal accountabilities Supporting Senior Stakeholders: Coordinating detailed and frequently changing national and international travel arrangements, including itinerary planning, securing visas and other travel documentation, arranging car/rail/flight/hotel bookings in accordance with IFRS Foundation travel policy. Supporting other teams and individuals with diary management, scheduling, travel, accommodation, and visa support. Setting up meetings as requested, supporting diary updates, and creating itineraries as required. Providing general administrative support, such as meeting support documentation, correspondence, and arranging dinners. Managing logistics for meetings, conference calls, and video conferences. Proactively managing diaries, offering solutions, and working across various time zones. Providing backup support to other executive coordinators as needed to meet deadlines, including working closely and covering for colleagues on their days off. Assisting with internal and external meetings to ensure conferences and meetings run smoothly. Undertaking ad hoc projects as required. Required skills And experience Previous experience supporting a senior team in an international environment and managing complex and frequently changing travel and meeting arrangements across time zones. Excellent organisational and administrative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work collegially with others and effectively engage with staff and stakeholders at all levels, both in-person and remotely. High level of autonomy, resourcefulness, and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work flexibly, remain composed under pressure, respond to changes and conflicting demands constructively, and prioritise work appropriately. Excellent oral and written English language skills, with the ability to draft clear, succinct, and appropriate correspondence and documents. Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) is required. Preferred Document management. Application closing date : 11th July 2025 Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date. Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide. We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter. Show more Show less

Title: Executive Assistant

Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you‚Äôll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You‚Äôll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us‚Äîwith the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager (Part Time) ‚Äì Workplace & Office Operations
Description: Your role As our Office Manager , your role goes beyond creating a pleasant atmosphere ‚Äì you're responsible for building and maintaining the foundation of a well-structured, safe, and smoothly functioning office workspace and infrastructure. With a solution-oriented and hands-on mindset, you take ownership of the spaces, routines, and resources that keep our daily office life running. Infuse positive energy into the work environment, putting smiles on the faces of employees, applicants, suppliers, and visitors You will take full ownership of our office infrastructure for more than 250 people ‚Äì this includes planning and organizing the office layout, coordinating furniture needs, and ensuring a functional, well-designed workspace You'll also manage security and access control, making sure everyone can work safely and efficiently Regular facility checks and ensuring safety compliance are also part of your weekly routine Coordinate and manage relationships with vendors and service providers to ensure a seamless day-to-day office operation Collaborate closely with our Office Management team of three to continuously improve our office workflows, support internal teams, and foster a culture of sustainability and operational excellence Your profile Ideally, you have professional experience in Administration, Office Management, Reception & Front Desk, Business Operations, or Operations Management You should have experience working in large office spaces and managing their operations ‚Äì know-how in office expansions or multi-site operations is a big plus! Ideally, you also bring knowledge in office safety & security management, office space and furniture planning, and facility maintenance, and understand their importance for operational efficiency and the overall employee experience You embody an open, helpful nature, combined with an independent working style and a strong desire to take ownership of your projects You have very good communication skills in both English and German, and you're available for 32 hours per week starting from November What we offer An appealing discount on all of our products ‚Äì from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation' We offer German and English language courses ‚Äì financed entirely by us! Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Contact Sabrina Thome Apply for this job About Us Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy ‚Äì as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations. We take our ecological responsibility very seriously : Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable. We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues. We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don‚Äôt match with 100% of the requirements. Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you‚Äôll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You‚Äôll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us‚Äîwith the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less
