Title: Office Manager (Part Time) ‚Äì Workplace & Office Operations
Description: Your role As our Office Manager , your role goes beyond creating a pleasant atmosphere ‚Äì you're responsible for building and maintaining the foundation of a well-structured, safe, and smoothly functioning office workspace and infrastructure. With a solution-oriented and hands-on mindset, you take ownership of the spaces, routines, and resources that keep our daily office life running. Infuse positive energy into the work environment, putting smiles on the faces of employees, applicants, suppliers, and visitors You will take full ownership of our office infrastructure for more than 250 people ‚Äì this includes planning and organizing the office layout, coordinating furniture needs, and ensuring a functional, well-designed workspace You'll also manage security and access control, making sure everyone can work safely and efficiently Regular facility checks and ensuring safety compliance are also part of your weekly routine Coordinate and manage relationships with vendors and service providers to ensure a seamless day-to-day office operation Collaborate closely with our Office Management team of three to continuously improve our office workflows, support internal teams, and foster a culture of sustainability and operational excellence Your profile Ideally, you have professional experience in Administration, Office Management, Reception & Front Desk, Business Operations, or Operations Management You should have experience working in large office spaces and managing their operations ‚Äì know-how in office expansions or multi-site operations is a big plus! Ideally, you also bring knowledge in office safety & security management, office space and furniture planning, and facility maintenance, and understand their importance for operational efficiency and the overall employee experience You embody an open, helpful nature, combined with an independent working style and a strong desire to take ownership of your projects You have very good communication skills in both English and German, and you're available for 32 hours per week starting from November What we offer An appealing discount on all of our products ‚Äì from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation' We offer German and English language courses ‚Äì financed entirely by us! Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Contact Sabrina Thome Apply for this job About Us Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy ‚Äì as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations. We take our ecological responsibility very seriously : Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable. We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues. We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don‚Äôt match with 100% of the requirements. Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. Title: Office Manager (Part Time) ‚Äì Workplace & Office Operations
Description: Your role As our Office Manager , your role goes beyond creating a pleasant atmosphere ‚Äì you're responsible for building and maintaining the foundation of a well-structured, safe, and smoothly functioning office workspace and infrastructure. With a solution-oriented and hands-on mindset, you take ownership of the spaces, routines, and resources that keep our daily office life running. Infuse positive energy into the work environment, putting smiles on the faces of employees, applicants, suppliers, and visitors You will take full ownership of our office infrastructure for more than 250 people ‚Äì this includes planning and organizing the office layout, coordinating furniture needs, and ensuring a functional, well-designed workspace You'll also manage security and access control, making sure everyone can work safely and efficiently Regular facility checks and ensuring safety compliance are also part of your weekly routine Coordinate and manage relationships with vendors and service providers to ensure a seamless day-to-day office operation Collaborate closely with our Office Management team of three to continuously improve our office workflows, support internal teams, and foster a culture of sustainability and operational excellence Your profile Ideally, you have professional experience in Administration, Office Management, Reception & Front Desk, Business Operations, or Operations Management You should have experience working in large office spaces and managing their operations ‚Äì know-how in office expansions or multi-site operations is a big plus! Ideally, you also bring knowledge in office safety & security management, office space and furniture planning, and facility maintenance, and understand their importance for operational efficiency and the overall employee experience You embody an open, helpful nature, combined with an independent working style and a strong desire to take ownership of your projects You have very good communication skills in both English and German, and you're available for 32 hours per week starting from November What we offer An appealing discount on all of our products ‚Äì from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation' We offer German and English language courses ‚Äì financed entirely by us! Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Contact Sabrina Thome Apply for this job About Us Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy ‚Äì as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations. We take our ecological responsibility very seriously : Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable. We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues. We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don‚Äôt match with 100% of the requirements. Title: Executive Assistant
Description: CHAMPAGNER F√úR ALLE. Das ist unser Ziel. Gro√üartige Produkte zu erschwinglichen Preisen anzubieten, dazu beitragen, dass sich Menschen ein gutes Leben leisten k√∂nnen. Ganz einfach! Die TSI ist ein Familienunternehmen mit einer klaren Zukunftsperspektive, denn bei uns steht der Kunde im Mittelpunkt. Ob Lebensmitteleinzel- oder Gro√ühandel, unser Fokus liegt darauf, hochwertige Lebensmittel zu liefern und einen erstklassigen Service zu bieten. Als Spezialisten in einem dynamischen Marktumfeld wachsen wir seit Jahren kontinuierlich. Unsere vielf√§ltigen Produkte finden Sie in den Regalen vieler namhafter Handelsketten weltweit. Zur Verst√§rkung unseres Teams in Berlin suchen wir ab sofort eine/n engagierte/n und erfahrene/n Executive Assistant (m/w/d) f√ºr unsere Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung. In dieser Schl√ºsselposition haben Sie die einzigartige Gelegenheit, tief in unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln einzutauchen. Sie unterst√ºtzen die t√§gliche Arbeit der Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung und erwerben dabei wertvolle Kenntnisse, die nicht nur Ihre berufliche Expertise erweitern, sondern auch Ihre pers√∂nliche Entwicklung f√∂rdern. Ihre Aufgaben: Unterst√ºtzung der Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung bei operativen und strategischen Aufgaben. Koordination und Organisation von Terminen, Meetings und Reisen. Vorbereitung und Nachbereitung von Besprechungen, inklusive Protokollf√ºhrung. Bearbeitung von vertraulicher Korrespondenz und Dokumenten. Verwaltung und Priorisierung der eingehenden Anfragen an die Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung. Erstellung von Pr√§sentationen, Berichten und Analysen. Projektmanagement und Unterst√ºtzung bei der Umsetzung von Unternehmensprojekten. Schnittstellenfunktion zu internen Abteilungen und externen Partnern. Ihr Profil: Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Betriebswirtschaft, Management oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation. Mehrj√§hrige Erfahrung als Executive Assistent (m/w/d) oder in einer √§hnlichen Position. Hervorragende organisatorische F√§higkeiten und ein ausgepr√§gtes Zeitmanagement. Souver√§nes Auftreten und Diskretion im Umgang mit sensiblen Informationen. Sehr gute Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch, sowohl schriftlich als auch m√ºndlich. Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) und modernen Kommunikationsmitteln. Proaktive, l√∂sungsorientierte Arbeitsweise und hohe Eigeninitiative . Wir bieten Ihnen: Enge Zusammenarbeit mit einem tollen und erfahrenen Team. Ein attraktives Gehalt. Einen krisensicheren Arbeitsplatz in der Konsumg√ºterbranche. Eine strukturierte Einarbeitung, viele Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten die auf Ihren pers√∂nlichen Interessen basieren. Wundersch√∂nes Office mit neuester Technik, h√∂henverstellbaren Tischen im Herzen Berlins mit einer guten Verkehrsanbindung am Potsdamer Platz. Coole Ideenwettbewerbe mit Preisvergaben. Regelm√§√üige Firmen- und Teamevents. Spannende Einblicke in die Welt des Handels. Kostenlose Getr√§nke, Kaffee und Obst. Mitarbeiterrabatte i.H.v. 25% auf TSI-Artikel. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagekr√§ftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen inkl. Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und Ihres n√§chstm√∂glichen Eintrittstermins. Bitte senden Sie diese ausschlie√ülich per E-Mail in Form einer PDF-Datei an jobs@tsi.de zu H√§nden an Larissa Leipold oder Elena Dmitriev. Sie k√∂nnen auch unser Bewerbungsformular auf unserer Homepage nutzen (Siehe unten Bewerber Button). Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you‚Äôll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You‚Äôll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us‚Äîwith the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less

Title: Mitarbeiter Im Kundenservice
Description: Als fortschrittliches Technologieunternehmen im Gesundheitssektor positionieren wir uns als dynamischer Gesundheitsmarktplatz. Mit einer Markterfahrung von √ºber 6 Jahren haben wir insbesondere w√§hrend der Pandemie eine bemerkenswerte Wachstumsentwicklung erlebt, uns erfolgreich weiterentwickelt und unsere Strategie neu ausgerichtet. Unser zentral gelegenes B√ºro in Moabit beheimatet rund 20 engagierte Mitarbeiter, die in einem flexiblen, hybriden Arbeitsumfeld t√§tig sind. Zweisprachigkeit ist bei uns Standard. Aktuell fokussieren wir uns darauf, von einem Start-up zu einem Scale-up zu wachsen, um unser ambitioniertes Wachstumsziel zu erreichen. Unsere Unternehmenskultur zeichnet sich durch Innovation, Teamgeist und ein tiefes Engagement f√ºr herausragenden Kundenservice aus. Mit den Zertifizierungen ISO 9001 und ISO 27001 untermauern wir nicht nur unsere Effizienz in den Prozessen, sondern auch unsere Hingabe an die Datensicherheit. In unserer kontinuierlichen Entwicklung suchen wir erfahrene und engagierte Mitarbeiter im Kundenservice (m/w/d). Aufgaben Sie haben ein offenes Ohr f√ºr unsere Kundinnen via E-Mail und Telefon. Sie nehmen Kundenbeschwerden an und garantieren eine kompetente und l√∂sungsorientierte Behandlung. Sie l√∂sen knifflige F√§lle und gehen Problemen gerne auf den Grund. Bei schwierigeren Fragestellungen arbeiten Sie eng mit Ihren Kolleginnen zusammen und entwickeln gemeinsam L√∂sungen und Vorgehensweisen. Sie haben ein Auge f√ºr Verbesserungspotenzial und sind gerne an der Umsetzung beteiligt. Sie arbeiten eng mit unseren Spezialist*innen aus Marketing und Entwicklung zusammen. Qualifikation Sie bringen bereits erste Jahre Erfahrung im telefonischen und schriftlichen Kundenservice im B2C oder B2C Bereich sowie im Umgang mit CRM-Systemen mit. Sie lieben es, die W√ºnsche der Kundinnen im direkten Kontakt zu erf√ºllen und im Austausch mit Kolleginnen eine eingeschwei√üte Einheit zu bilden. Erfahrung in der B√ºroorganisation und -verwaltung. Kommunikationsst√§rke und Teamf√§higkeit. Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office-Anwendungen. Deutsch und Englisch flie√üend in Wort und Schrift. Freundliches und professionelles Auftreten. Benefits Einen klasse Arbeitsplatz in einem abwechslungsreichen und spannenden Arbeitsumfeld. Die M√∂glichkeit, eigenverantwortlich zu arbeiten und Ideen einzubringen. Ein motiviertes und freundliches Team. Attraktive Verg√ºtung und Benefits. Wenn Sie Teil unseres Teams werden m√∂chten, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung. Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you‚Äôll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You‚Äôll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us‚Äîwith the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you‚Äôll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Benefits We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits: You‚Äôll get 20 days of statutory holiday, plus 8 additional days from us‚Äîwith the option to buy up to 5 more each year + 2 days of volunteering leave + 1 day a year to focus on your well-being Urban Sports Membership discount Retirement & pension plans BVG ticket discount (50%) MPB Employee discount and uplifts Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) Learning Management System (the "MPB Learning Lab")- You'll have access to thousands of free courses to up-skill in any areas you'd like, personal or professional Enhanced paid parental leave Summer and winter employee events Financial assistance scheme Milestone Gifts - ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher to celebrate the arrival of your new baby; ‚Ç¨150 Amazon voucher for you and your partner when you tie the knot or enter into a civil partnership Dog friendly office Show more Show less

Title: Office Manager (Part Time) ‚Äì Workplace & Office Operations
Description: Your role As our Office Manager , your role goes beyond creating a pleasant atmosphere ‚Äì you're responsible for building and maintaining the foundation of a well-structured, safe, and smoothly functioning office workspace and infrastructure. With a solution-oriented and hands-on mindset, you take ownership of the spaces, routines, and resources that keep our daily office life running. Infuse positive energy into the work environment, putting smiles on the faces of employees, applicants, suppliers, and visitors You will take full ownership of our office infrastructure for more than 250 people ‚Äì this includes planning and organizing the office layout, coordinating furniture needs, and ensuring a functional, well-designed workspace You'll also manage security and access control, making sure everyone can work safely and efficiently Regular facility checks and ensuring safety compliance are also part of your weekly routine Coordinate and manage relationships with vendors and service providers to ensure a seamless day-to-day office operation Collaborate closely with our Office Management team of three to continuously improve our office workflows, support internal teams, and foster a culture of sustainability and operational excellence Your profile Ideally, you have professional experience in Administration, Office Management, Reception & Front Desk, Business Operations, or Operations Management You should have experience working in large office spaces and managing their operations ‚Äì know-how in office expansions or multi-site operations is a big plus! Ideally, you also bring knowledge in office safety & security management, office space and furniture planning, and facility maintenance, and understand their importance for operational efficiency and the overall employee experience You embody an open, helpful nature, combined with an independent working style and a strong desire to take ownership of your projects You have very good communication skills in both English and German, and you're available for 32 hours per week starting from November What we offer An appealing discount on all of our products ‚Äì from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation' We offer German and English language courses ‚Äì financed entirely by us! Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Contact Sabrina Thome Apply for this job About Us Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy ‚Äì as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations. We take our ecological responsibility very seriously : Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable. We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues. We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don‚Äôt match with 100% of the requirements. Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you‚Äôll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. Title: Office Manager
Description: üöÄ EU Office Manager üöÄ üìç Location: 10783, Berlin üíñ Department: People & Workplace üìÖ Position type: Full time The role We're looking for a personable and organised Office Manager to help keep our Berlin office running smoothly and make it an even better place to work. You'll be at the heart of our creative and vibrant workspace, ensuring everything stays well-organised and flows efficiently and that everyone feels welcome and supported. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety and loves working with people. From keeping the day-to-day operations in order to help shape how our office grows and evolves, you‚Äôll be involved in exciting projects that truly make a difference. If you like taking initiative, solving problems, and being part of a supportive team, we want to hear from you! This is a great opportunity to build your career while having a real impact every day. What you will be doing Maintain a positive office atmosphere and ensure smooth daily operations: Create a happy, productive space where things run efficiently. Coordinate onboarding for new Berlin employees and serve as the main point of contact for staff and visitors: Welcome new joiners and support staff with office needs. Oversee office facilities and cleanliness in collaboration with the Facilities Manager, ensuring a safe, efficient, and tidy workspace: Keep everything safe, tidy, and running well. Collaborate on workspace improvement projects: Partner with the team to enhance shared spaces and create a more functional, comfortable, and inspiring office where people can thrive. Lead health, safety, and sustainability initiatives, including educating staff on recycling practices: Promote a greener, safer office with simple, effective actions. Manage office supplies, including ordering and restocking essentials like refreshments and stationery: Ensure the team has what they need, when they need it. Help organise inclusive company events and create a welcoming experience for visitors: Foster team connection and deliver a warm, professional welcome that reflects MPB's culture and values. What we are looking for Proficient in German (C1 level): this ensures strong local communication. However, day-to-day office life happens primarily in English. Experience or strong interest in office management: You're ready to jump in and take charge. Highly organised with strong attention to detail: You spot the small things that keep the big picture running. Self-motivated and independent: You take initiative and get things done. Flexible and adaptable: You adjust smoothly as priorities and needs evolve. Positive, professional attitude with strong task management: You stay upbeat and focused, even on busy days. Our Values; applied üåç Better, Connected: You'll help create a warm, inclusive atmosphere by welcoming new team members, supporting staff daily, and keeping the Berlin office a vibrant and collaborative space. üí° Empowering and Empowered : You'll take ownership of your work and give others the tools, clarity and support they need to thrive - whether through onboarding or everyday office support. üîé Insight-driven : You notice the small things that matter, listen to team feedback, and make smart decisions to keep our office running smoothly and effectively. üå± Agents of Change: You‚Äôll play a key part in driving improvements across the office, leading sustainability efforts, and adapting to the changing needs of a growing team. üåü Focussed on Excellence: You bring structure and high standards to everything from supplies and cleanliness to events and health & safety - ensuring a great experience for all. üöÄ Passionately Ambitious: From improving processes to organising events, you‚Äôll bring energy and initiative to everything you do - helping us go the extra mile for our people and our purpose About MPB We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you‚Äôve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you‚Äôre already a pro. We recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community here at MPB. Our commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects us as one with the diverse community of visual storytellers that we serve. MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow. Title: A&R Manager - Continental Europe & Africa
Description: Berlin HQ, fulltime, starting July 2025, permanent contract Sony Music Continental Europe and Africa works with wide range of artists including Maneskin, Damiano David, Purple Disco Machine, Lost Frequencies, Gyakie, DYSTINCT, James Arthur, Jain, Amelie Lens, Oxlade, Sam Feldt, 1Da Banton and many others. We are currently seeking an A&R Manager to join the team in Berlin. Key Responsibilities 1. Executive Support Serve as primary liaison to both VPs of A&R, translating their strategic goals into clear action plans. Consolidate scouting reports, performance data, and project updates into succinct briefs and dashboards. Coordinate cross-functional meetings, meeting agendas, and reports follow-ups, and decision milestones. 2. Artist Discovery & Talent Scouting Proactively scout emerging talent across the region, emphasizing artists with international growth potential. Use analytics platforms and social insights to spot early-stage trends. Cultivate a network of artists, managers, agents, and tastemakers to maintain a strong talent pipeline. 3. Data-Driven A&R Strategy Evaluate streaming, social, and audience data to assess artist momentum and market fit. Produce regular trend and opportunity reports for both VPs, highlighting high-potential acts. Shape signing strategies that align regional opportunities with Sony Music‚Äôs global objectives. 4. Artist Project Management Oversee artist development from concept through release, managing timelines, budgets, and resources. Partner with marketing, promotion, production, and creative teams to deliver cohesive roll-outs (albums, singles, campaigns). Track key milestones, flag risks early, and ensure on-time, on-budget execution. 5. Creative-Session Coordination (Writing, Recording, and Camps) Plan and schedule songwriting, toplining, and recording sessions, securing studios, writers, producers, and feature artists. Draft creative briefs, circulate reference materials, and align all contributors on artistic direction and deliverables. Manage session budgets, PO requests, and invoicing, collaborating with Finance and Business Affairs for timely clearances, contracts and payments. Maintain detailed session calendars, call sheets, and credits; archive stems, lyrics, and session reports for future use. 6. Remix Commissioning & Feature-Artist Collaboration Identify and secure remix producers/DJs that expand a track‚Äôs reach in key genres and territories. Source, evaluate, and pitch potential feature artists whose fanbases and brand align with project goals. Negotiate deal terms, clear rights, and manage contracts for remixes and features in coordination with Business Affairs. Coordinate creative briefs, stems delivery, approvals, and release schedules; ensure all credits and metadata are accurate. 7. Collaboration & Internal Support Review artist submissions, demos, and proposals alongside the VPs and the broader A&R team. Provide operational oversight to keep multiple projects progressing smoothly. Act as a communication bridge between artists and internal stakeholders, ensuring expectations remain aligned. 8. Industry & Market Insight Stay ahead of industry shifts, emerging tech, and consumer-behavior changes. Attend showcases, festivals, and conferences to deepen market knowledge and expand your network. Monitor the competitive landscape, continuously refining scouting focus and strategy. Your Profile Strong passion for music with knowledge of repertoire and culture from the region and eager to understand the industry‚Äôs structure and business models. A proactive and reliable team player, capable of handling sensitive information. Highly organized, structured with attention to detail who can multi-task and remain calm under pressure. Flexible and quick in adapting since priorities can frequently change. Excellent administrative skills & verbal and written communication skills. Engaging, sociable and solution driven personality. No stranger to International time zones and considerate when dealing with multiple stakeholders from different cultural backgrounds. Fluent in English (German and any other language optional). Open for junior and medior level experience What we offer An inclusive environment that fosters diversity and innovation. Opportunities to develop and implement your ideas. Competitive compensation and a streaming subscription of your choice. Flexible working hours and remote work options. Access to exclusive events and concerts at our Berlin Sch√∂neberg headquarters. A platform to showcase your talent and take on exciting challenges from day one. Show more Show less

Description: Cinema Manager in UCI Luxe Gropius Passagen (m/w/d) Berlin Du liebst leidenschaftlich Filme und hast den Wunsch, flexibel zu arbeiten? Title: Senior Manager Revenue Systems And Processes
Description: About Staffbase We inspire people to achieve great things together. Our mission is to help organizations unlock the power of inspirational communication. Our award-winning communications channels - intranet, employee app and email - deliver experiences that drive engagement and inspire hearts and minds. We're headquartered in Chemnitz, Germany, with offices in many locations throughout the world, including New York, London, Berlin and Dresden. Our international team counts more than 750 employees from 45+ nationalities and we have a growing base of 2200+ customers that want to transform their employee experience. We are rapidly scaling, post-Series E ($115 million funding), have strong-growing revenue, and our customers love us. As the Senior Manager of Revenue Systems and Processes, you will lead a team of CRM specialists and Revenue Systems and Processes specialists, building the next generation of operational infrastructure. You will be the key architect and leader of scalable, data-driven, and AI-enhanced systems that empower our GTM teams. What you'll be doing Own the revenue systems roadmap, including evaluation, implementation, and integration of systems such as CRM, CPQ, commission tools and revenue intelligence platforms, ensuring alignment with business needs and a seamless user experience Implement AI-driven process optimization to boost productivity and reduce complexity (e.g., intelligent lead routing, predictive forecasting, automated opportunity insights, and GenAI-powered deal support) Streamline and simplify revenue-related workflows, including introduction of AI to accelerate Sales and CS productivity and enhance cross-functional collaboration, driving automation and reducing manual processes Lead CRM governance and deployment initiatives, partnering with cross-functional teams to increase adoption, data integrity, and reporting capabilities. Enable intelligent GTM workflows, incorporating AI-driven processes across Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Finance teams through effective system integration and process alignment Own the end-to-end commission process, including setup, optimization, automation, and reporting in alignment with compensation plans Design, implement, and manage the compensation plan process in partnership with Finance, Sales, Partners, and CS Leadership, driving annual revisions and managing updates as needed Develop and maintain a scalable territory and account segmentation model that supports business expansion to new markets and aligns with our go-to-market strategy Lead and develop a high-performing team, providing clear direction, coaching, and career development to support individual growth and team success Build and lead a team of system analysts and operations professionals focused on delivering scalable, AI-enhanced business solutions What you need to be successful 7+ years of experience in Sales/Revenue Operations or GTM Systems, with proven experience in AI/automation enablement in a SaaS or enterprise software company Understands the interconnected nature of GTM systems, and thrives at the intersection of technology, process, and business strategy 3+ years in a team leadership or management role Strong understanding of CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) and other AI-powered GTM technologies like Gong, Clari, Gainsight, or similar Experience designing and implementing AI-driven GTM use cases (e.g., next-best-action, intent data, churn prediction) Demonstrated ability to design, implement, and optimize complex business processes Experience with commission and compensation plan management Knowledge of territory design and account segmentation strategies Strong project management and stakeholder engagement skills Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment What you'll get Competitive Compensation - we offer attractive salary packages including LTIP (unit-based Long Term Incentive Plan) Flexibility - we offer flexible working time models and the option of hybrid work, and support this with a yearly flex work allowance of ‚Ç¨1560 Growth Budget - all employees get a yearly budget for external training of ‚Ç¨1000 and one day off for growth per year (increase to two days in 2nd year) Recharge - with 31 vacation days annually (incl. one floating holiday), plus pro rata fully paid Fridays off during August Wellbeing - Monthly Wellbeing Allowance ‚Ç¨35, from fitness to mental health, hobbies to relaxation Support - we're offering a company pension scheme Health - The offices are equipped with fruits, drinks and snacks and ergonomic workplaces Team Building - Regular team and office events including the yearly Staffbase Camp Volunteers Day - you'll get one day off per year for supporting a social project Employee Referral Program - one of your friends is a fit to one of our full-time openings? Refer them and get a referral bonus paid Show more Show less

Title: Manager In Training Programme (Mit) 2025 - Berlin
Description: SOHO HOUSE MANAGER IN TRAINING PROGRAMME (MIT) 2025 Are you wanting to take your first steps into a hospitality management role at Soho House? Our one year rotational management development programme has been designed to provide you with the knowledge, skills and behaviours for you to thrive and develop your career at Soho House. Working across numerous business functions and departments, you will spend time with key stakeholders within our food and beverage operations, rooms division, membership, events and finance teams. WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR? We are looking for candidates with hospitality industry experience or an academic hospitality graduate who are eager to learn and passionate about hospitality. If you're flexible on location and not looking for a 9-5 desk-based job, this could be the perfect opportunity for you. YOUR JOURNEY From day one you will be given the you will be given the opportunity to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment, where you will be encouraged to think creatively and problem-solve on a daily basis. You Will Also Benefit From Mentoring opportunities from our leaders Increased responsibilities with every rotation Ongoing assessment and comprehensive feedback Engagement and development within the wider hospitality industry Upon completion, you will have gained invaluable operational experience and will be well equipped to take on a management position within the Soho House group or within the wider hospitality industry. Title: Iam Manager
Description: Team The Information Security Team at Raisin is a central function supporting all organizational units across multiple jurisdictions. We help the business navigate complex regulatory environments, design secure processes, and align technology practices with evolving compliance needs. This role will directly support the Compliance Manager in operationalizing risk and compliance activities. Your Responsibilities The IAM Manager is responsible for coordinating the day-to-day operations, rollouts, and process improvements of the organization‚Äôs Identity and Access Management (IAM) systems. This role focuses on ensuring smooth onboarding of new systems and applications into the IAM environment, managing access governance and re-certification campaigns, and acting as a central point of communication between technical teams, business units, and compliance stakeholders. Key Responsibilities Coordinate the onboarding and integration of new applications, systems, and services into the existing IAM infrastructure. Lead periodic access reviews and re-certification processes across the organization, ensuring compliance with internal policies and external regulations. Act as the primary liaison between business units, IT, security teams, and vendors regarding IAM processes and integrations. Manage IAM system operations, including monitoring, reporting, and ensuring SLA adherence. Develop and maintain IAM process documentation, workflows, and user guides. Plan and coordinate IAM-related projects such as system upgrades, new feature deployments, and audit remediation efforts. Support audit and compliance initiatives by providing documentation, evidence, and subject-matter expertise on access governance. Identify opportunities for process improvements and increased automation within the IAM lifecycle. Monitor KPIs and metrics related to IAM operations and prepare regular reports for leadership. Ensure that identity management practices align with the organization‚Äôs security and risk management objectives. Establish IAM governance frameworks and ensure compliance with policies and industry standards Address IAM related findings from audits and mitigate vulnerabilities Your Profile Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience). 5+ years of experience in IAM coordination, access governance, IT operations, or project management roles. Familiarity with IAM principles such as provisioning, de-provisioning, access certification, RBAC, and SSO. Experience managing projects or operations involving IAM platforms such as Okta, Azure AD, or similar systems. Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously. Experience working with cross-functional teams, including IT, HR, Compliance, and external vendors. Knowledge of regulatory requirements such as SOX, GDPR, HIPAA, etc. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Preferred Qualifications Project Management certification (PMP, Prince2, or equivalent) or strong project coordination background is a plus Experience supporting identity governance and administration (IGA) platforms. Understanding of audit requirements related to user access and entitlements. ITIL certification or experience in IT service management frameworks. Key Competencies Coordination and project management Strong stakeholder communication Problem-solving and proactive issue management Risk and compliance awareness Process orientation and continuous improvement Attention to operational detail Join our mission, join our team - and grow with us! At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which connects more than 65 different nationalities. You'll find us in our modern and open office in the trendy Kreuzberg district with a view of the Spree River, ideally connected to public transportation and surrounded by a variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities. As Part Of Our Team, You Will Benefit From Employee Development Budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 and four full training days per year. Access to Babbel for continuous language learning. Flexible working hours, home office and 30 vacation days. A company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20%. Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than ‚Ç¨20 per month. Do you miss being in the office? The Deutschland Ticket gets you there, which we subsidize with ‚Ç¨25 per month. Love cycling? With JobRad, lease the bike of your choice and enjoy tax savings, plus Raisin covers your monthly insurance costs. Hungry all the time? Snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks provided at the office. You are moving from another country or city to join us? We may support your relocation. About Us Raisin is the trailblazer in the savings and investment space. Founded in 2012, the fintech company started by opening the $95+ trillion deposits and investments market of the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States to consumers. Today, Raisin serves more than one million customers in these three markets, offering savings products as well as investment and pension products. This makes the Berlin-based fintech one of the leading global savings and investments marketplaces. Savers get a wider choice of attractive products with the ability to move their money freely. In addition, financial service providers get best-in-class marketplace solutions for their customers, and banks get better access to retail funding. Raisin operates its own B2C marketplaces in Europe and the U.S. under the brands Raisin and WeltSparen. In Germany, the company offers ETF-based investment and retirement products in addition to savings products. Raisin works with over 400 banks and financial service providers from over 30 countries We are backed by renowned international investors such as b2venture, Deutsche Bank, Goldman Sachs, Greycroft, Headline, Index Ventures, Latitude Ventures, Orange Ventures, PayPal Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Ribbit Capital, Vitruvian Partners and M&G. At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which connects more than 75 different nationalities. In total, we have 7 offices across the world: Berlin, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Madrid, Manchester, Munich and New York. We also think it‚Äôs important to take the time to celebrate our hard work and achievements together, with events like our yearly summer and winter party, as well as a couple of smaller get-togethers. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. Title: Senior Manager, Open Banking, Europe Government Engagement
Description: Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid. Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa. Job Description The Senior Manager, Government Engagement is a full-time role which can be based in Sweden (Stockholm), Germany (Frankfurt or Berlin) or Netherlands (Amsterdam), and will report to the VP, Europe Government Engagement, based in the UK. Some travel in the region will be required from time to time. This role is focused on Government Engagement (GE) across the Visa Europe region. It requires strong collaboration with GE market leads and subject matter experts across the Europe region on linked initiatives, and works in close coordination with the GE team in Brussels. The role may also provide industry expertise and support to global colleagues as required. The role supports wider GE strategies, including providing support for executives to execute strategic engagement with Governments across the region, and helping to ensure that policy frameworks are conducive to a fair, competitive and successful operating environment for current and future business. Headline objectives of the role are: Strengthen leadership in the marketplace, increasing impact on government policy to enable the Visa 2030 corporate strategy. Directly and through relevant colleagues, nurture reputation in priority local markets through cultivating long-term, trusted relationships with critical government and regulatory stakeholders and by promoting Visa/Tink as a constructive partner to enable growth. Seek to safeguard ‚Äúright-to-play‚Äù, as an enabler of the Visa 2030 corporate strategy, through the identification and execution of engagement strategies. In alignment with the GE strategies and relevant market priorities, execute strategic client engagement focused on adding qualitative and meaningful value to the business relationships. Promote a culture that maintains the highest degree of collaboration, integrity, inclusion and accountability. What we expect of you, day to day: VISA AS A CRITICAL PARTNER: Produce a Government account plan on Open Banking in close collaboration with GE leads and hub colleagues. Create and execute opportunities to demonstrate the value of Visa/Tink across the region to Government partners, in lockstep with local cluster/regional GE leads. Execute strategic presence and representation at important political, policy and industry events in priority markets, alongside and in consultation with GE colleagues and corporate affairs functions as appropriate. SUPPORT CORE BUSINESS AND GROWTH: Proactively monitor the external political and policy environment. Identify, assess and seek to address major risks to business objectives, alongside other functions, and co-ordinate/manage preparations of our positions and responses. In collaboration with GE colleagues, regulatory policy and legal, work alongside the business to support growth ambitions. DRIVE CLIENT VALUE: Partner with priority client directors, country managers and RMDs to gain a deep understanding of top client priorities. In alignment with client directors, country managers and RMDs, undertake systematic, ongoing GE engagement with key clients, as dictated by GE priorities and strategies. Seek to identify opportunities to showcase GE credentials and skillset to add value to the business relationship with clients. Work in alignment with Government Solutions to help position Visa/Tink as a partner to Governments. Additional Requirements: Work constructively in different markets with other functions, across the regional and global environment, in a matrix environment. Share know how and expertise with GE counterparties in other Regions. Help drive the continuous enhancement of function, toolkit and staff. Support open, timely and targeted communication with executives to ensure awareness of main regulatory, policy and engagement developments and strategy to protect the business and reputation. Maintain a relentless focus on the bigger picture, adopting a strategic approach. Promote diversity and inclusion in all engagements. This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager. Qualifications Demonstrable experience in Open Banking essential and in push payments very desirable ‚Äì in a relevant position of Government or industry engagement or consultancy Proven experience of senior executive engagement and managing upwards Very strong collaborator required Proven strategic advocacy skills Good inter-personal skills and stakeholder management experience Excellent written and spoken communication including presentation abilities Strong digital services and/or technology interest desirable Strong analytical skills Ability to act independently and flexibly within a multi-disciplinary matrixed team A relevant degree in Politics, Economics or Law is desirable, but not essential Additional Information Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law. Show more Show less

Title: A&R Manager - Continental Europe & Africa
Description: Berlin HQ, fulltime, starting July 2025, permanent contract Sony Music Continental Europe and Africa works with wide range of artists including Maneskin, Damiano David, Purple Disco Machine, Lost Frequencies, Gyakie, DYSTINCT, James Arthur, Jain, Amelie Lens, Oxlade, Sam Feldt, 1Da Banton and many others. We are currently seeking an A&R Manager to join the team in Berlin. Key Responsibilities 1. Executive Support Serve as primary liaison to both VPs of A&R, translating their strategic goals into clear action plans. Consolidate scouting reports, performance data, and project updates into succinct briefs and dashboards. Coordinate cross-functional meetings, meeting agendas, and reports follow-ups, and decision milestones. 2. Artist Discovery & Talent Scouting Proactively scout emerging talent across the region, emphasizing artists with international growth potential. Use analytics platforms and social insights to spot early-stage trends. Cultivate a network of artists, managers, agents, and tastemakers to maintain a strong talent pipeline. 3. Data-Driven A&R Strategy Evaluate streaming, social, and audience data to assess artist momentum and market fit. Produce regular trend and opportunity reports for both VPs, highlighting high-potential acts. Shape signing strategies that align regional opportunities with Sony Music‚Äôs global objectives. 4. Artist Project Management Oversee artist development from concept through release, managing timelines, budgets, and resources. Partner with marketing, promotion, production, and creative teams to deliver cohesive roll-outs (albums, singles, campaigns). Track key milestones, flag risks early, and ensure on-time, on-budget execution. 5. Creative-Session Coordination (Writing, Recording, and Camps) Plan and schedule songwriting, toplining, and recording sessions, securing studios, writers, producers, and feature artists. Draft creative briefs, circulate reference materials, and align all contributors on artistic direction and deliverables. Manage session budgets, PO requests, and invoicing, collaborating with Finance and Business Affairs for timely clearances, contracts and payments. Maintain detailed session calendars, call sheets, and credits; archive stems, lyrics, and session reports for future use. 6. Remix Commissioning & Feature-Artist Collaboration Identify and secure remix producers/DJs that expand a track‚Äôs reach in key genres and territories. Source, evaluate, and pitch potential feature artists whose fanbases and brand align with project goals. Negotiate deal terms, clear rights, and manage contracts for remixes and features in coordination with Business Affairs. Coordinate creative briefs, stems delivery, approvals, and release schedules; ensure all credits and metadata are accurate. 7. Collaboration & Internal Support Review artist submissions, demos, and proposals alongside the VPs and the broader A&R team. Provide operational oversight to keep multiple projects progressing smoothly. Act as a communication bridge between artists and internal stakeholders, ensuring expectations remain aligned. 8. Industry & Market Insight Stay ahead of industry shifts, emerging tech, and consumer-behavior changes. Attend showcases, festivals, and conferences to deepen market knowledge and expand your network. Monitor the competitive landscape, continuously refining scouting focus and strategy. Your Profile Strong passion for music with knowledge of repertoire and culture from the region and eager to understand the industry‚Äôs structure and business models. A proactive and reliable team player, capable of handling sensitive information. Highly organized, structured with attention to detail who can multi-task and remain calm under pressure. Flexible and quick in adapting since priorities can frequently change. Excellent administrative skills & verbal and written communication skills. Engaging, sociable and solution driven personality. No stranger to International time zones and considerate when dealing with multiple stakeholders from different cultural backgrounds. Fluent in English (German and any other language optional). Open for junior and medior level experience What we offer An inclusive environment that fosters diversity and innovation. Opportunities to develop and implement your ideas. Competitive compensation and a streaming subscription of your choice. Flexible working hours and remote work options. Access to exclusive events and concerts at our Berlin Sch√∂neberg headquarters. A platform to showcase your talent and take on exciting challenges from day one. Show more Show less
